1122221121121.content:
"URRRRAAAAAAPPPP!"

Sakura's belch sent her whole body jiggling to and fro, the scent of digesting pasta heavy in the air as Ino politely ignored the flagrant breach of good manners.

"Sakura, don't you think you should try a diet?"

"Why? Ashamed to be seen with a tubbo like me?"

"No! Not at all! I hope I never-"

But Ino was cut off by Sakura laughing, lightly punching Ino on the shoulder. "The look on your face! No Ino, I know you don't think that and I know you're worried about me. I appreciate the concern, really, but there's nothing for me to do but eat and get bigger."

"Nonsense, there's plenty you could do. You could...you could help me in my training with Lady Tsunade! It starts in a couple weeks and I'm sure she wouldn't mind allowing you to aid me."

"But I'm not a ninja, Ino. I'm just a normal woman."

"Exactly! It's unorthodox and that's why it'll work! Please, come with me to visit Lady Tsunade and see what she says okay?"

"Will you pay for dinner and dessert afterwards?"

"Yes, just please come with me!"

Sakura nodded, earning herself a tight hug from her smaller friend.

"Oh thank you Sakura, you won't be sorry!"

But Sakura was just thinking about the dinner her loaded friend would get for her and just what kind of dessert Ino's money could buy that she hadn't tried yet.
1122221121121.title: The next day, Ino spends some time with Sakura,...

choices: Ino takes Sakura to Tsunade, her potential revealed
Later that night, Hinata approaches an exhausted Naruto
11222211211212.content:
For once it was a rather quiet afternoon for the Hokage and her lovely assistant. No one to interrupt them, no important life-threatening decisions and even the paperwork was simple enough that it was finished within a few hours. Now, Shizune wasn't all work no play as many people thought, she liked to enjoy the small things every now and then, permitted that her Hokage wasn't acting like an arse. So it was the black haired woman that suggested locking up the office, placing some sound-absorbing jutsu and bringing in enough food to feed a small platoon of shinobi. It would be perfect, they would feed each other in particularly restrictive clothing, enjoy each others company and save the finale at their personal Hokage mansion. Ten minutes into their lovely little session and a rather meek knocking came from the door, much to the utter annoyance. Stuffing the remains of a creampuff into Shizune's mouth, Tsunade quickly cleaned up their little mess, and begrudgingly went to open the door.

"Um, hello Hokage, I hope I'm not interrupting anything." said the ever-shy girl as she had a worried expression on her cherubic face.

"Just make it quick before I decide to send you to Suna for a few years." nodding the girl sat her generous rear down on the chair in front of the desk and began to tell her story of what had happened during that mission, how they were able to connect and actually talk with another in a casual fashion. However, after the mission, their relationship regressed to what it was before, casual greetings and a seemingly lack of interest in her.

"And the other day, I saw him hanging out with three different girls. Not that I was stalking him or anything..." said Hinata as her voice began to trail off into silence. Tsunade let out a sigh, this girl was simply too meek to have a shot with the 'wild' Naruto.

"Look Hinata, there isn't much I can tell you. You need to go out an actually talk to him, maybe try getting closer to him as a friend before you take the plunge. I also can't keep putting you on easy missions with him, he's a rather highly sought after shinobi after all and I plan to milk him as much as I can to be perfectly honest." With a downtrodden face, Hinata nodded, feeling stupidly week and 'useless' once again. Seeing such a sad showing, Shizune got an idea. Digging through the drawers of the desk, and ignoring all of the empty bottles of sake, she found a few small pieces of paper and shoved them into Hinata's plump hands.

"These are coupons for Naruto's favorite BBQ place that we use to bribe him into taking certain missions. I guarantee if you offer them to him, he'd fall in love with you on the spot." With a smile Hinata thanked the two as she moved her heavy body off of the chair and left the two in peace once more.

"Finally, can we just go back home? I'm sure there won't be a cataclysmic attack tonight or anything."

"As long as you don't drink yourself into a stupor, we can do whatever the hell you want."
11222211211212.title: Meek and Wild

choices: Ino's training begins. Hinata ends up impressing Naruto at the BBQ.
Sakura apologizes to Ino later that night at dinner.
112222112112121.content:
A few days later, Ino approached Tsunade, Sakura hanging back a bit.

"Tsunade-sama, this is my best friend Sakura. I know it's not exactly normal for me to request this, but during my training with you, I'd like her to be with me."

Tsunade's brown eyes moved towards Sakura, who looked both scared and bored. "What do you think about this, Sakura?"

"I'll get some food, right?"

Tsunade snorted at that, nodding. "Yes, you'll get some food. Very well, Ino, I'll accept Sakura here. But she is just there for moral support. No training, no helping you cheat in any tests I devise for you, understood?"

"Of course Hokage, thank you for being so gracious."

Tsunade nodded, getting to her feet and wrapping Ino in a tight hug. "You might be a twig but your heart's the biggest I've seen. That's what makes you the perfect student for me. Now go along, relax, because starting tomorrow you're on my schedule."

Ino nodded, bowing again and moving to grab Sakura's hand and take her along when Tsunade stopped her with a look. "Just a moment Ino. I'd like to have a word with Sakura here."

"Okay. Sakura, I'll be waiting outside, okay?"

"Alright Ino. Hope you've got your checkbook ready because I'm starving!"

Ino just smiled, darting out of the office, leaving Sakura and Tsunade alone.

Gone was any jovial air Tsunade had had with Ino. Instead, she was glaring at Sakura, her immense figure making Sakura feel small for the first time in years.

"You know what I see when I look at you, Ms. Haruno?"

"A fat person?"

"Not a person. A pig. A greedy, selfish, hog who just lives to stuff their face. Don't think I haven't heard about you abusing Ino's friendship. Always having her foot your bills, always doing what you want, never what she wants to do. Ignoring her attempts to help you find something to do with your life except eat."

"I'm not like that! I don't...Ino's money's just..."

"Then why did you come here? Because Ino asked you or because she promised dinner afterwards?"

"For dinner...but Ms. Tsunade-"

"It's Hokage to you, Ms. Haruno."

"It's true, Hokage, I've been abusing Ino, taking advantage of her kindness to me. I just...she's come so far and I...I just eat all the time. I don't have any talent, any type of skill. But she seems to think I do, that no matter how many times I tell her I'm nothing, she doesn't hear it."

"That's why, Ms. Haruno, you're going to do your best to be the kind of friend Ino deserves, understood?"

"Yes, Hokage."

"Because if you ever treat Ino like I just saw again, I'll banish you from the village, understood?"

"Yes, Hokage."

"Now go, enjoy your last pig out with Ino. Because after today, you will start your journey towards becoming the kind of companion Ino deserves."

Sakura nodded slowly, waddling away and leaving Tsunade alone.

Rubbing her temples, Tsunade sighed.

"Shizune, hurry up with that paperwork! I need some cuddling time!"

"Well come and help me and we can get to that!" Shizune replied.

Sighing again, Tsunade got to her feet and waddled towards her lover's office.
112222112112121.title: Ino takes Sakura to Tsunade, her potential reve...

choices: ...she tells Ino everything Tsunade said to her. Ino is...displeased.
...her stomach growls. Ino decides to remedy that, first.
1122221121121212.content:
"Sakura? Are you...all right?"

Calm chewing, followed by an audible gulp. "Yes Ino. I'm fine."

The blonde would have rolled her eyes by this point and just resumed eating her salad while watching (with some morbid interest) her obese best friend wolfing down her fourth plate of ribs. Except there were some things missing from that picture. Some very important things that only a best friend would notice to be amiss. For one thing, Sakura was eating calmly. Yep. Total elegance and minding her manners. No raising the bowl of ramen to her face and downing the contents, no savagely tearing meaty ribs apart with her sausage-shaped digits before doing more tearing with her teeth in a savage manner, and no grabbing her choice of beverage and gulping the liquid down as though she'd been parched for days. What had happened to all her usual eagerness when it came to eating, especially earlier today? Something really was amiss.

"Okay, I'm done..."

"Wha?"

Ino blinked two times, then a third time. She eyed her friend carefully. "Sakura, are you sure you're fine?"

Sakura grunted, leaning back on her creaking chair--an action which made the creaking noise sound all the more ominous--and resting her hands on her big belly, which didn't look the least bit filled to the brim. "Yes, I told you that already, Ino. Why wouldn't I be?" she huffed thickly, very much annoyed.

Ino's eye twitched and she looked unimpressed. Really Forehead? You want to play this game?

"Gee, I don't know," the blonde spoke in a semi-theatrical tone, mocking the idea of being convinced. "Maybe it's the water? Must taste salty for you to not be eager to chug it down like you normally do. Maybe it's the ribs? They must not be cooked properly, probably the chef's fault, or maybe the sauce is spoilt. Maybe it's the ramen? The noodles could be underheated, or something, or maybe it just doesn't compare to Ichiraku's. Ooh, ooh! Wait! I know! Maybe it's the fact that you said you were done, when all you've had is two plates of ribs and just one bowl of miso ramen!"

"What's your point, Ino?" Sakura muttered. "I can go to a public restaurant and not make myself look like a fatass every now and then. Even I can show some restraint."

Ino grumbled something about the pinkette's stubbornness.Then, releasing a calming sigh, she looked at her chubby best friend seriously. "Sakura, seriously, I wasn't born yesterday. Yeah, I'm not a smartass like Shikamaru, but even I know when something's off with my best friend."

"Ino, really, you're worrying about noth--"

"And I would know," the blonde interrupted. "Because just this very afternoon, all you could think about was eating, and emptying my wallet, and then ever since we left the Hokage's mansion, you've been acting all, well, weird! And not the funny kind of weird. I'm talking the 'I'm-not-myself-so-I'm-gonna-worry-my-friends' type of weird." Ino paused, seemingly finished. Then, she blinked two times upon realizing something very crucial in her own words. "Come to think of it, when you came out of your chat with Lady Tsunade, you've had a pretty down look in your eyes," the blonde's eyes got bigger. "In fact, you looked like you were about to cry."

"Oh," Sakura's eyes widened, looking like she'd been caught under a headlight. "I was, uhh, I was in awe! Yeah, that's it! I mean, it was overwhelming, being in the same room as the biggest woman in Konoha... Plus the fact alone that she wanted to talk to me, eheh." The nervous chuckle she threw at the end, combined with the forced smile on her chubby face, only made Sakura's attempt to put her friend's concerns at ease all the more unconvincing.

To Ino, this was obvious. Sakura may try to fool her, but Ino would never forget the look in her eyes as she left the Hokage's room. Those emerald eyes, looking ready to brim with tears. It reminded her of their younger days, for those were the eyes Sakura would have some days when she was getting bullied for her weight. The days when Ino would come out of the Ninja Academy, go looking for her best friend, only to find her looking miserable, having been subjected to bullying and teasing because of her appearance and because her ninja friend wasn't there to protect her.

It was a look Ino hated utterly. She is usually a friendly, if teasing, person, but mess with her best friend, and you get the stinger of the Yamanaka.

"Sakura," said Ino. "What did Lady Tsunade want to talk to you about?" She did not miss how the mere mention of the Hokage's name made the rotund pinkette flinch slightly.

"N-Nothing, it's not important..."

"Sakura."

"I'm serious, Ino! If you're worried because I'm not stuffing myself like I usually do, I guess it's because I had a big lunch earlier, remember? That plus this dinner? I'm totally full!"

It was right there that Sakura's prodigious middle turned traitor and made its presence known with a loud growl.

Ino stared blankly.

Sakura's face reddened and she immediately looked down, her chubby hands grasping her huge gut as though trying to commune with it and tell it to quiet down.

"Sakura."

Startled at the sound of Ino's voice, Sakura jerked her head up, her facial flab jiggling. "I-I-Ino! Really! All Lady Tsuna--Lady Hokage and I talked about was...was... Argh, it's not important, okay?! What is important is what I have to say...!"

Ino's eyes widened slightly, startled when Sakura corrected herself on addressing the Hokage. "Sakura?"

"Ino," Sakura took a deep breath to calm herself, then released it gently before looking her dear friend in the eye. "Tonight isn't about me, all right? It's about you."

"It's not my birthday."

"That's not the point! It's just..." Sakura's countenance shifted into one of sorrow. "Y-You've always been such a great friend. A friend so great, you deserve better than having to lower yourself to hanging out with a greedy tub of lard like me..."

Ino's mouth fell. "Sakura, what--"

"Please let me finish. You deserve a better friend than me... All we do is what I want to do, I take advantage of your generosity, and I'm pretty sure your wallet money is broke because of me. And yet you've done so much for me... You always say I'm good for something even though I don't feel like I am, you've always stuck around me for heaven knows why, and...and..." she paused to close her eyes, already feeling tears building up.

Ino was silent, staring in absolute concern at her quivering friend.

Sakura opened her eyes, tears trailing down her plump cheeks gently. "What I'm trying to say is I'm sorry. I'm sorry for everything. I'm sorry for being such a worthless, scumbag, greedy hog of a friend. You deserve so much better than me. I'll understand if you don't want to be friends anymore..." she closed her eyes again and lowered her head, whimpering ever so slightly with every quiet sob. She brought one of her chubby hands to cover her eyes in an attempt to stop her tears.

This was it, was all Sakura could think. She was about to lose her best friend. And it wouldn't matter. Because she had been such an awful person...no, hog, just like Lady Hokage had said. She wasn't a person. She was just a greedy glutton who abused her friendship for her own selfish reasons. She didn't deserve anybody. She deserved to just be isolated and disappear, unknown and unmourned.

"Sakura...!"

The pinkette's eyes widened upon feeling a slim, warm hand over her flabby one. She looked to see Ino giving her a gentle, beatific smile.

"Whoa there, Billboard Butt. What's all this about you being a bad friend?"

Sakura was stupefied. "B-But Ino, didn't you hear me? I am..."

"Oh stop it, you're gonna make me get all emotional," Ino shook her head, but her smile was intact. "Seriously, though, where did that idea come from? Sure, you like to eat at my wallet's expense, but hey, nothing a good mission payout won't fix."

"But..."

"Sakura," Ino said with mock seriousness, using her free hand to flick the pink-haired heavyweight on the forehead. "Chill. Ever heard of dynamics? Sure, to some people it might seem like you use me for a free meal, and I hang out with you to make me feel good about myself, but who cares? 'Cause that's what other people think. And who cares what other people think? You and I both know the truth," Ino's eyes closed and she gave a beaming smile. "That we're great friends. Always have been, right?"

"Ino..." Sakura sniffled, wiping her eyes with a napkin. After finishing cleaning her vision, she returned Ino's smile.

Seeing her beaming made Ino's smile widen. Atta girl.

Then, she gave Sakura's pudgy hand a gentle grip and loosened the cheeriness in favor of a little seriousness. "Now, will you please tell me what Lady Hokage said to you?"

Sakura's cheered spirit dimmed just a little bit. "Ino, I really don't know..."

She was cut off by Ino giving another reassuring squeeze to her hand. "Forehead, seriously, I think after that melodramatic heart-to-heart stuff we just did, I'm pretty sure this is the part where you feel you can open up to me," she smiled. "After all, you're my best friend. It's my job to listen if something has you worried."

Sakura absorbed the blonde's words, looking slightly hesitant.

Then Sakura, smiling a little, opened her mouth and...
1122221121121212.title: Concerned Skinny

choices: She's always been fat, but hides it.
She developes an eating disorder.
More.
1123.title: More options.

choices: The next day...
11231.content:
"Well gang." Said Kakashi, putting down his favorite pornographic novel. "I'd say we're about done."

"About time!" Screamed Naruto, throwing down the last of the woven baskets into the rest of the pile. Today's mission entailed carrying roughly a hundred of them from one end of Konoha to the other. In other words, grunt work. "I'm starving!"

"We all are, Naruto. We had to skip lunch to do this mission." Said Sakura.

Sasuke just folded his arms and grunted. Today's mission had been taxing on everyone indeed, patience was wearing thin. All the more reason for Kakashi to send his troops home for the day.

"Go on home then, and get some food and rest. There will probably be a more...interesting mission tomorrow."

"Does that mean we'll actually get to do important stuff!?"

"...Just go home Naruto."

The blond ninja pouted and followed his teammates who were turning to leave. Like always, Team Seven was walking home together after a long day, though the silence between its members was almost deafening. It had been a grueling past few hours indeed, no one really wanted to talk.

However, Naruto dared to break the quiet reflection of his teammates. "So...What are you guys doing now?"

A chorus of growling stomachs answered him. He chuckled slightly. "I guess that means everyone's going to get food, huh? Want to head over to the ramen bar?"

"I can't." Said Sakura, patting her belly slightly.

"How come?"

"Dieting."

The concept was completely daft to her male counterparts though. "Again? What for? You look fine, Sakura!"

"That's easy for you to say, Naruto."

She was glaring at him now, so he quietly backed down. Though he didn't understand diets, Naruto knew well enough by now that arguing with Sakura over them was just not worth the effort. She'd always turn down invitations to meals and free food, even if her stomach growled like it had a tiger in it. From Naruto's perspective, Sakura looked fine. Always thin enough, athletically built, and shapely. But you wouldn't even see her so much as eat a candy bar, she was so insistent on sticking to some sort of unspoken code.

Naruto shrugged, it was that stubborn attitude that made him like Sakura so much. But still, she'd always have eyes for Sasuke. Everyone knew that, even if he ignored her.

"That's your house, right Sakura?" Asked Sasuke.

"Right. Thanks Sasuke." She replied, nearly forgetting her stop. She turned and waved, smiling as she left. "See you guys tomorrow."

Her friends said their good byes as well, then immediately got into getting on each others nerves. Without Sakura to stand between them, it was hopeless, they had started bickering.

"So, what about you Sasuke!?"

"I am NOT going to your ramen bar, Naruto."

"Aw, come on! What are you? A cheapskate?"

"What'd you say..."

Sakura continued smiling to herself, expecting to hear a trading of blows in a few moments. Even if they argued a lot Naruto and Sasuke were good friends. Loyal, trusting, they would never hide a thing from Sakura. She opened the door to her house.

They'd never hide a thing...

~

When she stepped inside, Sakura's expression did a complete one hundred and eighty degree turn. She was frowning to herself, a lingering look of disappointment.

Her house was empty and dark, her parents had gone out of town for the week so she was all alone. In a way though, she was glad. It was embarrassing for her to walk around with her true nature showing, even if they were her parents.

There was a mirror in the front hall of her home, it was the usual place where her parents left any messages for her through sticky notes. A fresh bright yellow slip of paper beckoned her over. She read it.

"Sakura, I know you're still dieting but please try to eat! There's some leftover fish from last night in the fridge. Remember, you're only going to run out of energy faster if you don't have something to fuel yourself with. Stay healthy! -Mom"

Sakura groaned and crumpled up the paper, even if her parents ordered her to she wasn't going to eat. This would be the third time in a row she'd be going to bed hungry. She felt her stomach wobble around like a bag of water, groaning in displeasure.

"Shh..." She whispered to it. The strain was probably getting to her.

It was difficult to keep the jutsu up for so long during extended periods of the day, especially on missions. And while she had gotten accustomed to it her whole life, it made the end of everyday feel like she had been running a marathon.

But before she undid the jutsu, she glared angrily at the stranger in the mirror. The thin her. The fake her. An insect in comparison to girl underneath the skin. The most pathetic person Sakura ever laid eyes on. She hated her reflection like this, it diligently obeyed the orders of society. It answered the call for the need to be perfect in every way. But it wasn't to blame, the reflection wasn't the crime.

Sakura did the appropriate hand signals. "Release!"

In an instant, the fake her dissolved in the mirror. The wool covering the eyes was pulled back, the reflection was no more. It's cheeks bulged out, as did its stomach, its breasts, its arms, its butt. Everything.

Her dress groaned slightly, readjusting itself to the new larger form it now held in place. The sound of her body, when it returned to its true shape, was similar to that of a balloon being filled up with air by a helium tank. And in a way it was invigorating. Like standing naked in the cold rain, feeling every single drop touch your body. Like showing the world who you really were.

Sakura looked somewhat pear shaped like this, her belly stuck out a good ways from her body as did her breasts. But it was her hips and butt that contained the most fat, giving her greater curves then her fake self could ever hope to have.

She looked solemnly at herself in the mirror.

Since she was born obese, Sakura had tried every single thing imaginable to lose the pounds. Her parents had taken her to doctors, specialists, even surgeons. Nothing could be safely done though to truly solve her big problem. She was destined to be this way for the rest of her life, hiding behind a jutsu that disguised her true self. After she found it in an old scroll at the bottom of a well when she was a kid, she had practiced for months perfecting the jutsu to the point where she could spend days using it. It was the first one she had ever learned, and as a result there wasn't a jutsu after it that she couldn't handle. Still, she hated using the jutsu, she hated that she had to hide what she was.

But that wasn't the crime. Tears formed in the pits of her eyes.

The crime was that it was allowed. That she was so weak and so spineless that she'd hide herself behind magic, smoke, and mirrors. That she let the words of others get to her. That she'd conform like every other coward.

The crime was that she let the fake reflection take control and be her face for the world, while the world remained unaware of the hidden flower beneath the skin. She was wearing a mask, and nothing more. And she hated herself, so much. So fucking much.

This wasn't the first time that Sakura would stare at a mirror and starting crying to herself, and it probably wouldn't be her last. As the tears feel, she knew she still had the small comfort that she was alone in her home. She had a whole night ahead of her and if what Kakashi was true, she had a busy day tomorrow. What she energy she couldn't get from eating she'd have to get from sleeping. She turned and left to go to bed.

This was her secret. One that she had never told anyone. One that she'd die if anyone discovered. This was the elephant on her back, the skeleton in her closet, the sorrow in her heart.

This was how she had spent her entire life.
11231.title: The Hidden Flower.

choices: Our Genin get to work, and get to know the clients!
The client makes the group breakfast, but Sakura "isn't hungry"...
112311.content:
The next day was business as usual for the Genin of Squad 7. Today's mission was to help the owner of a brand new resturant unpack and set up shop.

When they arrived on location they saw a rather impressive building in front of a large fountain. It was three stories high, made from the same material as most buildings in Konoha, every wall had thirty windows. The back where the kitchen was was the sole exception, the bottom floor missing it's windows.

Inside the first floor was a simple, spacious room, the floor was made from some kind of wood, more than likely Oak by the color. In the center was a plot of soil, the ground looked bone dry.

Still the Genin had no opinion on the place, more or less they were quite irritated. The main reason was because the client had asked for them to arrive at the literal crack of dawn, and Kakashi had been called off on some serious mission.

Sakura could feel herself practically nodding off as she sat down near the fountain, but she couldn't lest her jutsu be released. If it wasn't for her mastery of chakra control, Sakura would've already dropped the jutsu. One thing that helped keep her up was Naruto's incesant complaints.

"Ugh, when are these two going to get here already?" The blond asked yawning, "I just wanna get this mission over with and go back to bed."

"This will probably be an all day mission dunce," Sasuke replied, more agitated than usual. "It'll probably be awhile before we head home so get over it!"

"Why don't you-" Naruto began to yell when a loud honk was heard. The trio looked to see the unfamiliar sight of a moving van in front of them. In another, smaller vehicle came two strangers.

The first was a brown haired man, he seemed to be in his early forties. He was around 5'5 and about as big as Choji.

Next was a 17 year old girl, she was relatively pretty. Her hair was the same shade of sepia as the mans, and she was rather plump as well. Her rounded face seemed vibrant and warm.
112311.title: The next day...

choices: It was Naruto.
It was Chef Inshouku.
1123112.content:
"You must be the kind ninjas who are supposed to help us with setting up shop." Smiled the man, he tipped his driver's cap. "How do you do?"

Sasuke and Naruto gave the man a very displeased look, clearly not in the mood for pleasantries. Deciding to be friendly, least they'd all be unpleasant for the rest of the day to each other, Sakura answered the porky man's greeting.

"Yes, good morning mister...Uh..."

"Inshouku. Chef Inshouku." Smiled the man, he gestured to the girl behind him. "And this is my daughter, Shirayuri"

Shirayuri bowed, lifting her rich purple skirt up in the process. Sakura noticed a pair of purple wrist cuffs around her arms, but thought nothing of them. "How do you do?"

"What's your name, miss? And how about the two grumpy ones behind you?"

"Sakura Haruno. And these are my teammates Naruto and Sasuke."

"Charmed, well now that introductions are settled, how about some breakfast?"

Sakura blinked slightly. "Pardon?"

Inshouku laughed slightly. "Come now, surely you can't hope to work on an empty stomach. There's much to be done today and I'm not a chef for nothing. Call it a thank you."

"But we're not-"

However, a rumbling roar of stomachs interrupted Sakura's plea. Her teammates all winced in hunger. She tried pushing in her own in a feeble attempt to make it shut up.

"Your empty bellies say otherwise. Come, I can wipe up a quick something in a jiffy. I believe the kitchen was said to be in tact by the time of our arrival..."

And with that he turned to leave for the building, Shirayuri, Naruto, and Sasuke all followed him holding their stomach in eager anticipation. Sakura reached out to stop them but there was nothing she could do. She slumped and reluctantly followed them into the kitchen. Temptation was the biggest enemy of a diet.

~

They stepped into the empty restaurant and headed for the kitchen, as they went Chef Inshouku pointed out all the things that needed to be done. The boy didn't appear to be listening though.

"Now, as you can see we haven't quite set up shop yet. There are tables and chairs to be moved in from the van. I'll leave the heavy lifting work to the boys, for now. After that they'll need to install all the windows on the first floor, then there's cleaning..."

"Uh, Mr. Inshouku. What do you want me to do?" Asked Sakura.

He stopped at the kitchen door. "Oh, I have a big job for you and Shirayuri to do."

Opening the door, he pointed at the empty window stills. Outside behind the restaurant was a massive field of nothing but weeds and roots, cluttering up every single corner of the acre long yard. "We need to clear out that entire field of weeds."

Sakura could already feel her back killing her. "Ahh..."

"I don't expect you finish today, just try to make a sizable dent in it. Anyway." He started up the grill. "Who wants bacon?"

"Me!" Shouted Naruto, Sasuke, and Shirayuri at once.

The chef noticed Sakura hadn't said anything. "What about you, Sakura?"

She bit her lip. "I'm not hungry."

Her growling stomach spoke a different opinion. Naruto gave Sakura a concerned look, as did Shirayuri. Inshouku eyed her once but shrugged, focusing on the slices of meat sizzling in the pan.

"Suit yourself then. If you'd like, you can get started on clearing the field."

"Thank you, sir."

~

Groaning, Sakura stepped out into the field. The bright din of the early morning light forced her to squint slightly just to see beyond five feet in front of her. She was suddenly very thankful that Chef Inshouku didn't expect her to finish clearing the fields by the end of the day. The brown gnarled weeds went up to her waist, and that was at the lowest places. Some were even taller then her. Disgusting, similar, and tiresome weeds all around her.

Sighing, Sakura decided to get to work. Staring into space wasn't going to make the job go any faster. She reached for the first ugly stem and yanked real hard. The roots ran real deep into the ground, it took several forceful tugs to pull it straight out of the ground, she landed right on her butt hard with the weed in her hand.

"Oww..." She muttered, rubbing her sore bottom. This was going to take awhile.

As she tried to pull herself to her feet, something weird happened. She felt really dizzy, like she had been flipped around in circles. She caught herself as her legs gave way and shook in her head in confusion. She stood there holding her knees for a few brief minutes.

"Gah...What's wrong with me...?"

Had it been sleep deprivation? No, she had gone sleepless nights before and never had something like this happen to her. Her stomach, which was growling furiously with her, wasn't helping the problem at all. And with the strain of the jutsu...

"You need to pull them out by the roots." Said a female voice behind her.

Shirayuri was standing behind her, arms crossed with a look of wild amusement like she had been watching Sakura the whole time.

"Weeds are a lot like problems. You need to take them out by the roots."

Sakura gave a forced grin back. "Oh? Thanks for the tip."

But then Sakura winced again as another wave of hungry stomach growls overcame her. Shirayuri frowned, noticing the pink haired ninja's discomfort as she doubled over.

"You're dieting aren't you?"

"Is it that obvious?"

"Something like that, I had been on a lot of them myself. You should really eat something if you're going to be pulling weeds all day."

"You sound like my mom." Replied Sakura, brushing the dirt from her dress. "I'll be fine though."

Shirayuri held up a bag and tossed it to Sakura who looked at it in confusion. "What's this?"

"Rice cakes. Relax, they're non-fat. It's basically like eating celery." She gave a big smile. "I used to eat them all the time when I had my hunger pains."

Sakura opened the bag, inside were little patty shaped bits of food. She wondered if she could even call them food, they sort of looked like packaging peanuts. Taking one out she sniffed it. Odorless. She took a bite.

"...Tastes like paper."

Shirayuri laughed. "Yes, I think so too. You go on ahead and eat, I'll start working."

Though she didn't admit it, Sakura was extremely grateful for the food. Even the tiny cardboard tasting bite she took had soothed the savage growls of her stomach in an instant. She watched with mild interest as Shirayuri proceeded to pick the weeds from the fields, she was doing it with much more ease than Sakura had. The pulled weeds were neatly laid in a pile next to her.

"So, you went on diets too?" Asked Sakura, attempting to strike up a conversation.

"Several, all failed."

"Heh, that sounds a lot like me."

Shirayuri turned around, giving Sakura a surprised look. "Really now? You sure don't look like you need the diet."

Sakura mentally cursed herself. Of course it would look like she didn't need the diet, she had the jutsu. "Well...It's...Uh...It's complicated."

The pudgy girl just gave a warm smile, not revealing if she bought Sakura's clumsy excuse or not. The sun reflected brightly in the strands of her hair almost giving her an angelic appearance. Sakura felt safe around her for some reason. She wrapped up the bag of rice cakes; she had finished only half of it but at least her stomach had something besides itself to eat away at.

"Anyway...I'll just...Uh...Start helping."

She reached out for the nearest weeds but Shirayuri stopped her.

"Oh, don't pull those ones!"

"What? Why?"

"Because you should let them grow, they aren't ready to be plucked yet."

Sakura furrowed her brow. "But your father said to pull all the weeds."

"Don't worry about it, I'll talk to him about it. Here start over by me."

Shrugging, Sakura obeyed making sure to grab the weeds by the root this time. A few moments of speechless labor passed until Shirayuri interrupted the silence.

"Sakura's a very pretty name."

"Huh?"

"Your name. You're named after the sakura flower right?"

"Because of my hair color. Pink."

"Yes, your hair is very beautiful. You're very beautiful."

Sakura blushed slightly. "Thanks...You are too."

"We're both like flowers. My father named me after the word for a lily, after when mom died. He told me I was his flower, so he wanted to give me a beautiful name."

Sakura didn't really know how to respond to the girl's almost melancholy speech. She glanced over and saw that Shirayuri was still smiling to herself.

"It's a little ironic that two flowers like us have to work in a field of weeds. Don't you think?" She asked.

"I guess..." Replied Sakura.

There wasn't much time for conversation after that. Sakura had to focus on working, though she had food in her stomach now the pains were slowly returning. Silence filled the air as the two worked for hours, diligently under the beating sun. The pile of weeds steadily grew into a mountain.

Sakura stopped for a moment and wiped the sweat from her brow. At least she was getting a good workout from this. Then, someone tapped her on the shoulder...
1123112.title: Field of Weeds.

choices: Shira plays along
Shira doesn't play along
11231121.content:
It was Naruto Uzumaki, to the dissapointment of Sakura. More or less she had been hoping that it would be Sasuke.

"Oh, it's you Naruto." Sakura said in a more than dissatisfied tone.

"Hey Sakura, Shirayuri." the blonde replied, apparently not getting that Sakura was annoyed. " Chef Inoshoku wanted me to tell you guys that it's time to go for the day."

"It is?" Shirayuri asked wiping sweat from her brow. She looked a the sun, it had set long ago. Slowly rising up, the older girl patted Sakura on the back. "You did a good job Sakura."

"Eer...Thanks." The kunoichi was unsure of how to react to her new aquaintance's praise, let alone her earnest smile. "Well let's go."

Soon, the three youngsters were inside the first floor of the building, which thanks to Sasuke and Naruto was mostly finished.

Chef Inoshoku was sitting in a rather interesting wooden chair, while Sasuke was standing around looking indifferent.

Sakura was about to try and get to him, when Naruto came before her.

"Hey Sakura, I wanted to ask you something."

"What is it now Naruto?"

At this point the ninja in orange began to twiddle his thumbs. "Well I wanted to know if maybe you and I could, y'know go out or something?"

Sakura was a little surprised. Naruto had asked her out before, but he never seemed so shy about it. Maybe she had been too hard on him.

"Well sorry Naruto but Shirayuri and I are...going to go around Konoha.

"HUH?!" Both Shirayuri and Naruto exclaimed.

"Yeah remember? So you'd be familiar with the area?"
11231121.title: A flower's lie

choices: Naruto and Sasuke get into a fight.
Naruto gets left the crowd, the chef goes wandering off, Sasuke gets lost.
112311211.content:
Shirayuri opened her mouth as if to say something but then smiled and quietly closed it. Sakura shuddered slightly, she looked like the cat that had swallowed the canary.

"That's right...Sorry, I had almost forgotten about that."

Sakura felt a bead of sweat of relief droop down her forehead. Naruto slumped in depression though looked mildly relieved himself.

"I...Understand. Sorry, just figured I'd...You know...Ask..."

"Why not come with us then?" Smirked Shirayuri.

This time, Sakura was the one to be surprised. "HUH!?"

Shirayuri grinned an almost demonic smile hidden delightfully under her angelic face as she calmly played with her purple wristbands. "Sure. The more the merrier, right? Sakura won't mind, will you Sakura?"

Sakura gritted her teeth as Naruto's eyes perked up. "I guess not..."

This time it was Chef Inoshoku to sit up and speak. "What a splendid idea! This would be a marvelous chance to sample some of Konoha's fine dining! Please, allow me to treat you three for your hard work."

Realizing her 'plan' had spiraled out of control, Sakura tried to discourage him. "Mister Inoshoku we really don't-"

"Food would be good..." Muttered Sasuke, who hadn't eaten since breakfast.

"Let's get ramen!" Shouted Naruto.

"Then it's decided!" Exclaimed the chef. "Let's go out to eat!"

This man certainly was proving to vexing as Sakura slumped her shoulders. Oh well, at least Sasuke had asked to come along...

~

It was late spring on this fine Konoha evening, the coming summer was lingering in the night air. Flecks of pollen and swarms of bugs inhabited the sky, though it was still cold enough to cool down the ninjas after their hard day of work. An outsider might assume there was a festival in town judging by the happy noises and cheers coming from the street. But really, it was a spring night like any in Konoha as the group traveled down the people filled streets.

Sakura at been contemplating her shoes the entire time, with the crowded streets and the dim orange lights there was little talking she had to do during the 'tour'. Chef Inoshoku and Shirayuri seemed to be having the times of their lives, the chef insisted on stopping at every single food stand.

"Ohh! These are grilled octopus legs! What fascinating sauce they used!"

While Sasuke had paced himself with all the food, Naruto and virtually gorged himself and had become immobile roughly ten minutes into the tour. Begrudgingly, Sasuke was dragging him along on a wooden cart. Sakura hadn't eaten anything since she had gotten there.

Truthfully, she wanted to be alone for a moment. Waiting for a break in the crowd, she ducked before any of her teammates noticed she was missing and crept along the feet of the city streets.

Once in an alleyway, she stood up and brushed herself off. She walked into the darkness of the backstreets, escaping the flashing street lights and noisy people that inhabited them. Quiet. Alone. Not a soul but her own.

Walking along, she spotted a flight of stairs which lead to a small balcony. In the distance the world opened up to her like a book. She couldn't tell where the sky ended and ground began. Konoha's famed Hokage monument was the only definite landmark for the earth below the starry night sky. The building lights of Konoha seemed like stars themselves, Sakura felt like she was looking at the reflection on a large body of water under an ocean of stars. It was beautiful. She reached out to touch the view, expecting to feel a warm velvety sensation on her fingertips. But she felt nothing. She sighed.

"The world isn't so bad, sometimes, if you can just get out of it." Said a voice from behind her, surprising Sakura slightly.

Shirayuri, angelic looking as ever, was walking up the stairs. Sakura still wasn't too happy with her though.

"I was kind of hoping to be home by now..."

"Sorry?"

"Why did you invite Naruto to come with us? I didn't want to deal with him today and you knew that your dad would want to come along didn't you?"

Shirayuri frowned. "Is this a bad time?"

Sakura wanted to say something but couldn't. The strain of her jutsu was starting to wear thing on both her strength and patience. She bit her tongue and said another lie.

"...I'm sorry...It's just been a very long day for me."

Shirayuri didn't say anything, nor did her saddened expression change. She just walked next to Sakura on the balcony and looked up at the sky. The stars glittered in her eyes.

"They're beautiful, aren't they?" She said at least.

"What are?"

"The stars...Each of them is unique and bright and beautiful. They seem so special out there in the sky, don't they? Where everyone can see them. So beautiful. They make you seem insignificant..."

She paused, as if taking in the picture she had crafted for herself.

"Naruto seems to like you, you know."

"I know..."

"But?"

"It's not a mutual feeling."

"Ah."

Though she seemed content enough with Sakura's answer, Sakura felt that her reasoning wasn't good enough. She struggled to get the words out right, she felt she could trust Shirayuri for some reason.

"He's just so..."

"Eccentric?"

"...Yeah."

"So?"

"It just really makes me...Jealous...I guess..."

"How come?"

"Because..."

Sakura looked up at the sky.

"Because we all can't be stars...He's getting stronger, I think. Him and Sasuke too. They're both so powerful, so noticeable. Everyone gets to see them. It just makes me feel..."

She couldn't get the correct word, still. Or rather, she didn't want to say it.

"Insignificant?" Helped Shirayuri.

Sakura winced. She might as well as thrown a kunai knife at her gut. "Why am I telling you this..."

Shirayuri smiled. "Because you can't keep all your feelings locked up inside of you forever, right? I mean, an actor can wear a mask but at the end of the day he needs to take it off and take a bow on the stage."

"I guess..."

Shirayuri put an arm around Sakura's shoulder. "Stars are really far away you know. They take years to reach us out in space like that..."

The two girls looked on at the stars mapped out before them, lighting the sky like a group of actors performing a play for them. Sakura could have sworn she saw a shooting star dance across the deep blackness above her.

"...I think the brightest stars take the longest to reach us..."

Meanwhile...
112311211.title: Playful Posies.

Calmed down and went to find the chef
1123112111.content:
Naruto and Sasuke were both in the endless sea of food stands and people and both had high tensions.

They had lost track of Chef Inoshoku about thirty minutes ago while Naruto had insisted on trying out some kind of special oyster ramen.

Not only that, but Sakura and Shirayuri had both ended up missing as well. Sasuke was a little more than peeved because of this. He had been using his Sharingan to scout around while Naruto used his doppelgangers, but in time he grew fed up. He awaited Naruto's return before he sprung the news.

"Naruto, you can keep searching on your own. I'm heading home." He said as he deactivated his kekei genkai and started to leave. Of course the blond boy called out to him.

"Hey! you aren't just gonna quit, are ya?"

The darker haired boy only stopped momentarily and sighed. "It's your fault you dunce."

"What was that?!!" Naruto yelled in frustration. He awaited a response from Sasuke, who seeming copped an attitude out of nowhere.

"If you hadn't been stuffing your face so much you wouldn'tve choked, and we wouldn'tve lost track of our client." Sasuke explained as he turned around. "You may be a ninja, but you act careless.”

“Well excuse me Sasuke,” The jinchuuriki spat in frustration, “at least my brother didn’t kick my ass!”

In his fury, Naruto had touched a sore spot. One that in a clearer mind, he wouldn‘t have ever dreamed to broach.

Utilizing superior speed he copied from Rock Lee earlier on, Sasuke came upon his teammate, his eyes gleaming, crimson daggers with the Sharingan activated. When he spoke his voice was oddly calm sounding, but he was holding Naruto by the collar of his jumpsuit, his hand like a vice.

“Don’t EVER mention that traitor. You got that?”

Despite this intimidation, a large amount of fury was still in Naruto, making him want to challenge Sasuke further. “Let me go now.”

The preteen’s sky blue eyes slowly turned dark red, not unlike Sasuke’s own. The Kyuubi’s Chakra channeling itself through him.

Not saying a word, Sasuke threw Naruto back, but the ramen lover landed on both feet.

“Next time I won‘t let you go...” Sasuke said, as he walked off once more.

Naruto…

112331.content:
Years had passed since Madara's defeat and the ninja world was at peace.

In the village of Kohona, one pink-haired young woman woke up with a yawn, smirking a bit as she noticed her girlfriend still holding onto her.

"Ino, Ino, get up."

Ino blinked a bit before waking up completely, smiling slowly as she took in the sight of her naked lover before her.

"If your forehead was only a little smaller, you'd be perfect," Ino murmured, prompting a short but swift whack on the head.

"Way to ruin the moment, Ino-pig!" Though Sakura appeared angry, she was secretly amused. This was how their mornings usually went, Ino or herself would say something mean, the one who instigated the argument would then make breakfast.

So, as Sakura dashed to the bathroom, Ino headed towards the kitchen.

She was nervous.

It was almost the one year anniversary of the start of their relationship, after both women had been rejected by Sauske, and Ino had started to consider something.

She loved Sakura, from her big forehead to the smallest of her toes, but lately she had had these dreams of a Sakura a bit plumper.

Well plump wasn't the right word, Ino considered as she placed rasher after rasher of bacon into one of the pans.

Obese was a better one.

She wanted Sakura to get huge and she didn't know how to tell her.

As Ino kept preparing breakfast and wracked her brain for an answer to her dilemma, a pair of toned arms wrapped around her from behind and she received a kiss from her lover.

Instant.
Body part by body part / Other

Sakura runs into "guy trouble" in the village.
An odd ninja attacks the village center.
1141.content:
Sakura groaned slightly, groggy from all the early morning training she had been undertaking recently. But she knew well what the risks were for agreeing to become Lady Tsunade's apprentice, though she hadn't counted losing beauty sleep being one of them. Not that it mattered lately, since Sasuke had abandoned the village Ino had been leaving her alone for the most part.

Three months it had been. Three months of torturous beatings from the Hokage. Three months of intense medical practices that pushed her chakra control to the limit. Three months since both her teammates, Naruto and Sasuke, had left to do their own training. Yet Sakura held on. She wasn't going to be left behind again, she wasn't going to be a burden or someone they had to protect. That was what she kept telling herself, but that didn't stop her resolve from falling short every early morning.

"Why do these lessons have to be so early...?" she mumbled to herself, already knowing full well the answer. Being the Hokage, Tsunade was extremely busy and had little time during the day to teach her.

This meant that any the only free spots in her schedule were often at the crack of dawn or in the late evening. If she didn't feel that she hadn't already learned a lot, Sakura would have assumed Lady Tsunade was using these lessons as a form of stress relief by beating on her pupil. Each day opened new doors to jutsu and skills Sakura would have never have thought possible.

Today was no different from any other training day, except for the fact that Lady Tsunade had called for Sakura to come out into one of the open training fields outside the village. Usually this meant what they were doing was going to be too dangerous to perform indoors, the thought of another brutal beating only added to Sakura's grouchy mood. Still, she pressed onto the assigned training field, finding Tsunade standing in its center looking no more excited about the morning than she did.

"Good morning, Sakura."

"Good morning, Lady Tsunade."

"I suppose you're wondering why I called you out into the training field today?"

"Combat training again?" she honestly guessed.

Tsunade grinned in response. "Not quite. Remember when I told you how the best defense is a good offense? How a medical ninja must never find herself injured else the entire team will suffer as a result?"

Sakura nodded, recalling the intense brawls that followed afterwards.

"Well, there will come a time when a medical ninja will find herself unable to withstand an attack no matter how powerful her offense is. In these situations, she is doomed to perish unless she can come up with an equally powerful defensive move that may save her."

That all seemed like basic logic to Sakura. "But Lady Tsunade, isn't that obvious? I mean, you should hit when you can and block what you can when fighting, right?"

"True...But what if someone were to come at you with a move designed to destroy you even if you blocked it? What if someone came at you with the Chidori or the Rasengan? Even a light hit from either of those techniques will permanently put you out of the fight if you are unable to dodge it."

"So...We're practicing dodging?"

"No, we're going to be practicing absorbing the hit."

Sakura winced in displeasure, thinking she knew full well what would happen next. Tsunade had to laugh at her student's reaction.

"No, no. Not in the manner you're thinking of. What I mean is we're going to be practicing a jutsu designed to dampen the power of your opponent's attacks so greatly that it will render the attack harmless."

"That still sounds painful..."

"Not one bit, here I want you to come at me after I initiate the jutsu."

Tsunade took a wide stance, making sure both of her feet were beyond shoulder length. She made three simple hands signs, Bird, Ox, and Dog, before Sakura felt a strange burst of chakra be released within her teacher.

"You may attack me with your strongest attack, don't hold back Sakura."

Sakura smirked, after being pushed around it was nice to finally have a chance to take a swing at Lady Tsunade even if she was her master and Hokage. Sakura prepared her fist, building up the chakra in the same manner Tsunade had taught her these past few months. Though she was no master at it yet, she could easily decimate boulders with the power that she had. There was no way Tsunade was going to get away injury-free after this.

With a fair amount of power built up, Sakura charged right at her master. She swung her arm back when she was in range and closed her eyes as she rocketed it forward and waited for it to connect with her teacher's stomach.

There was no hard hit that Sakura was expecting. Instead, her hand felt like it had punched into something soft before rebounding back, sending her flying a few feet behind herself. As she opened her eyes and the dust cleared, Sakura saw that Lady Tsunade was standing just where she had been before, unmoved and not hurt in the slightest.

"Wow, I'm impressed Sakura. That had a lot more power than I was expecting. Good thing I prepared myself to take the blow."

"H-How..How did you take that!?" Sakura asked.

"You didn't see it? Well, no matter. That's what today's lesson is for. You're going to learn how to do that today, or at least the basics. It might take you a whole month to get to that point. For now I want you to practice two things today, the hand signs I did and your breathing."

"My...breathing?"

"Must I repeat myself? This is a highly advanced jutsu with unorthodox requirements, with any luck you'll be able to at least practice it the whole night. Let's meet here again after lunch sometime, I have a brief break then."

Sakura was still confused but nodded, wiping the dust off from her blouse as Tsunade headed back to the Hokage office to start her day of paperwork. The young girl still couldn't figure out how Tsunade had managed to completely take that attack, she shouldn't have kept her eyes closed when she swung at her.

"...What does breathing have to do with it?" She questioned herself.
1141.title: A New Lesson

choices: It doesn't affect the training.
It affects the training.
11411.content:
Considering the sun had just peaked it's head over Konoha's Hokage monument, Sakura figured the best thing to do right now would be to eat breakfast. After all, though she didn't use the taijutsu chakra enhancement for a long time, it still took it's toll on her energy. Her stomach happily agreed with her decision.

Most of the citizens were just beginning their day, though for Sakura it felt like the day was half over already. Stores were just opening up to the public, meaning her choices of cuisine were somewhat limited.

"Ugh, I wish Lady Tsunade didn't end the session so early...There's no where to eat!"

Indeed, many of the only restaurants available were for lunch or dinner only. Sakura's gut continued to growl in annoyance, demanding food and demanding it now. By stroke of luck, Sakura passed by a familiar blonde on her way home with the morning paper.

"Hey Sakura!" shouted Ino.

"Hey Ino..."

"What's the matter? You don't look too good."

Sakura drooped her shoulders. "It's nothing...Lady Tsunade ended our training session too early. None of the shops are open and I'm starving."

Ino frowned. Ever since her teammates had separated, Sakura had been getting more and more depressed by the day. She was starting to remind her of Shikamaru. "Well, that's no good. Want to eat at our house?"

"I wouldn't want to impose..."

"Nonsense! Breakfast just finished cooking and there should be plenty to spare."

Before Sakura could even give her answer, Ino grabbed her friend by the hand and started pulling her towards her home. She was determined to make her friend smile today, no matter what.

~

"Mmm. This is really good." Sakura muttered between mouthfuls of oatmeal.

Ino cast a worried glance. "Really? It's just plain old oatmeal, you haven't even had the eggs yet."

"I don't care...This is more than enough, thanks."

Sakura put her bowl down just as her stomach gave up an angry roar, suggested that she was not quite as full as she led on. In fact, Sakura's eating habits had been something Ino had been concerned about as of late. Every time she ate a meal, she'd always excuse herself early, never quite finishing anything.

"You really need to eat more, girl. Skipping meals while in training is a bad practice."

"I haven't been skipping meals..."

"No, but you have been eating like a bird lately, despite your stomach growling. Come on, I'm your friend Sakura. What's troubling you?"

"Nothing's wrong, just haven't had the time to eat lately. Got to train."

"Right...You and I both know that when Naruto and Sasuke trained they had time to stuff themselves silly, even if they ended up puking it all out."

Sakura laughed slightly, recalling the time they were in the Land of Waves and the ending contests the two got into. Those times seemed so far away for some reason, just thinking about it filled Sakura with a sort of sadness and realization. They'd probably never been the same food eating contest while in training kids again. It was as if everything had gotten serious all of a sudden.

"Well, at least I got a smile out of you." Grinned Ino.

"Yeah...Thanks for the food Ino."

"It's no problem. Hey, I know what will make you happy. How about a girl's day out? I don't have any missions today and my parents aren't even home."

Sakura would have liked that if not for her training that would start up again after lunch. She suddenly remembered she hadn't practiced the hand signs or her breathing at all, though she wasn't sure exactly what Lady Tsunade wished her to do.

"...I can't. I got to go back to train with Lady Hokage after lunch."

"Well that's still a few hours from now! Come on, let's have some fun!"

"But..." She didn't have time to protest, Ino had already grabbed her by the wrists and pulled her out the door.

It was a day that the both of them felt was well earned. They went shopping, did their hair together, cleaned and manicured their nails, flirted with some boys, and just relaxed. Ino tried her very best to make sure her friend was enjoying herself, and it worked. It took Sakura's mind off things, so much in fact that she had forgotten the things she was supposed to be practicing before her next training session. It wasn't until after lunch at the ramen stand did she finally remember.

"Crap!"
11411.title: Breakfast at Ino's

choices: The Jutsu worked as it had for Tsunade!
The effect was different
11413.content:
That same day training ended and Sakura had gone to the center of Konoha to buy groceries. She was still pondering what her mentor had told her earlier about breathing. Even ninja academy students know that proper breathing is necessary to attain the focus to do many jutsu, but the way Tsunade said it it seemed as if there was something more.

As the pink haired girl went into the shopping district to buy some food for dinner she heard a commotion. Turning to look and see what was going on she saw a group of villagers running away. Drawing near she saw a lone ninja with dirty blonde hair, he was tall and wel muscled, and was wearing a blank ninja headband. His eyes were bright but bored looking, his black and silver outfit attracting much attention.

"Who is that?" Sakura asked another ninja, a chunin who seemed to be watching. The man shrugged, but his expression was serious.

"No idea, the guy literally appeared out of nowhere. I'm going to check it out though." he said before going forward to confront the stranger. "Hey you, who are you and why're you here?"

The stranger rolled his eyes and started walking away, ticking off the konoha ninja off.

"Hey I'm talking to y-" he began before the stranger moved quickly, his palm was covered in darkness. The unknown ninja hit the man once and suddenly he was covered and rocketed backward into a building.

The blonde stranger then tried to go forward again, but this time Sakura got in front of him. She remembered she had a duty as a ninja of Konoha to stop anything that threatened her home's safety.

"Stop right there!" she said, standing confidently. She didn't have to beat him, but hold him off until more ninja came. The man looked amused.

"You're gonna fight me?" he asked, his voice surprisingly lax and jovial. Sakura said nothing but focused her chakra to her hands and legs for combat she then attacked.

She tried striking him with simple and effective attacks, but he evaded and deflected them all quickly. After a couple minutes she realized her attacks weren't working.

When she want backwards though, the enemy used that strange jutsu again and tried to hit her. Sakura just managed to evade from sheer luck. She knew it wouldn't happen a second time and backed away. She couldn't evade again or take it head on...She was stuck...Unless...

'This better work..' Sakura thought, breathing heavily as she performed the hand signs for Bird, Ox, and Dog. She focused as much as she could and got an odd sensation, she assumed it meant the jutsu worked.

The stranger's attack came in and...
