Went home and began to think bout her new desire...getting fat
Packed her things and ran into Naruto s she left
122.content:
It was another day at Konoha and Hinata Hyuga was in the Hokage's office, along with Naruto, Rock Lee, Sakura, Ino, and Sai.

Lady Tsunade called the six ninja together for a special mission.

"This mission is an A-rank mission, I need all of you to help protect a special member of a royal family from a foreign nation. She will be vacationing elsewhere in the Land of Fire and all of you will be required to stay with her for as long as she is our guest."

"So who is this woman anyway?" Ino asked as she listened to her superior. She was glad for a bt of travel, even if it was part of a mission.

"Her name is Lady Sanada, from the Land of Plenty. While you are there you will also have an ANBU black ops agent to guard her while sh rests. You all will take care of her at other times. I'm especially counting on Hinata's Byakugan and Sakura's medical ninjutsu." Tsunade continued.

"Hey, aren't you counting on me too Granny Tsunade?" the blonde knuklehead of the group asked.

"Of course Naruto. In any case she'll be waiting for you at the front gates in three hours. Be ready, and above all else try to keep her happy...She's a rather rich client and we could use the extra ryo."

"To cover for your gambling?" Naruto asked curiously, unwittingly he angered his suerior.

"Just go!"

After that Hinata...
122.title: Hinata's big adventure

choices: Sanada will be staying in the city, its their job to act as friendly bodygaurds!
Sanada is actually here under darker circumstance, she needs to move in with...
Sanada will be living in the Hokage's  mansion, its their job to be her friends!
1221.content:
Though her meeting was of the utmost importance, Lady Tsunade strictly admonished her as well as her other teammates that they not seem too conspicuous; while she also warned that complacency was a shinobi's deadly folly, when pressed on how they should act, Tsunade responded with a casual "play it cool" and dismissed Hinata, Naruto, Ino, Sakura, Lee, and Sai so that they may prepare for their journey and reconvene at the Hokage Mansion in three hours for lunch. Such familiarity was unheard of, especially not from the usually gruff Tsunade when given her tendencies; so everyone seemed a little anxious when, once again, she stressed that their client for this mission was very affluent and that her family held a lot of power in not only the Land of Fire, but all over the Ninja World...

Hinata's feet hardly strung an echo as she traipsed quietly down the hallways of the Hokage Mansion, her small whimpers and otherwise didn't warrant anything other than silence as she fretted over her meeting with the nobelman's daughter. What would she say to her? They were both from esteemed families, Hinata had been forced into playing with many other children of noble bloodline as a child, maybe she could build on that? No, that was silly. No doubt that Lady Sanada was a woman about her own age now. Hinata never did have that spark for connecting with people the way that some of the other villagers did. Naruto especially.

Oh Naruto...

Hinata's thoughts began to wander gently into daydreams as she imagined a yorely Naruto dressed handsomely in a traditional kimono, herself dressed accordingly as the two of them sat perched on her family's grounds; looking upwards dreamily at the sky before their vision loomed downwards to meet eachother's gaze. They smile, look away bashfully of course, and then... only if he wanted to, they would slowly turn back to one another. His lips would curl upwards into a smile, one that brought itself closer to the matching pair of dimples Hinata's close-mouthed grin sported. His lips would pucker slightly, she would let her mouth fall agape as his tongue slowly-

"LADY HINATA!!!", Rock Lee's boisterous bellowing had pulled a reluctant Hyuuga girl from her innocent daily fantasy, not so much as to her annoyance as much to her disappointment, and rushed to meet her side. Unlike the aforementioned clansman, Lee took quick bounding steps whose sounds were left bounding off the walls and floors as he eagerly rushed to meet his fellow comrade for this mission. "O-Oh, h-hi... Lee." Hinata said with a slight stutter, her mind still fresh with vivid images of that fictional kiss. "Haa" he exhaled, "I am glad to see that I am not the only one who is so nervous about meeting our client." the dogbrowwed individual said rather boldly, referring to just how red Hinata's face still was after her fantasizing.

"O-Oh!" Hinata exclaimed, if one could call it that, as she tentatively touched her face, "I, um, its nothing." she said dismissively, "So... um, when are we supposed to meet with the Hokage?"

"I have no idea!" Rock Lee said with unnerving confidence. Like, seriously unnerving. "Wh-What?" Hinata stuttered. "But a man of such youth, innocence and purity should hold no reservations when it comes to arrangements carefully set by his superiors!" he exclaimed with a fist pump, "I shall rush ahead and ask about the location of our mysterious ward so that I may relay the information back to you!"

His enthusiasm was met with a blank stare, not one of stupidity but one of patronization. Hinata was always more of a people pleaser. "W-Why don't you just stay here with me until the others arrive, that way neither of us have to be lonely?" Rock Lee smiled. Like, a normal person smile, not one of those crazy training smiles. "Sure thing, Hinata." he said, happily partaking in the merriment that was Hinata's one-girl team. "So, do you know anything about our client?" Hinata asked after a second or two of silence. After all, how much was there to talk about with Rock Lee? "I am afraid that I do not know any more than you do, Lady Hokage was very brief with her delegations today which is very odd for her."

"Bushy Brow!" came the familiar bark of yet another teammate as he trekked towards the pair.

"Naruto!"

Of course, it was Naruto. The jumpsuited ninja happily strolled down the hallways with both Sakura and Sai beside him. All of them had warm, inviting looks on their faces; though upon further inspection one could see a slight stain on Naruto's jacket and a slight roughing up of his cheek, which matched the whitening of Sakura's knuckles. Hinata giggled as she cleverly deduced that Naruto had stopped for an early lunch, Sakura found him and promptly punished him. And somehow Sai got into the mix, judging by some slight bruising and minor contusions. As Lee and Naruto met eachother with a fist bump, Sakura and Hinata began to commune.

"So you don't know anything either?" Sakura asked Hinata. The presence in the hallway wasn't one of idle teenaged gossiping; bent on spreading rumors (the absent Ino) and scaring the weaker minded of the clique (Naruto and Lee). No, the congregation going on between now all five members of the present party was one of honest intrigue regarding just who it was they were supposed to be protecting. Sai seemed to be keeping quiet, though there was no doubt he knew just as little as the others.

"I wonder if she's some kind of princess?" Sakura said brightly as her fantasies carried her away, "Who wears pretty dresses, has long beautiful hair, and kicks all the local mens' butts when they try to grab her ass!" Lee too, decided to join in, "I think that this mystery woman is one of more lethal beauty!" he began, "One who has mastered every dangerous art of taijutsu known to mankind! She would wear a tight gi and a blackbelt around her slender frame, and-

"Please, Lee, lets not delve into your sexual fantasies." Sai said coldly

"Yeah, I'd really like to stay far away from those." Sakura reaffirmed

There was a slight commotion in laughter as Lee got all watery eyed before a foreign voice emerged. "And I'd really like it if you guys would hurry up and get down to the dining room so Lady Tsunade doesn't blow a gasket!" All eyes turned to face Ino Yamanaka, who had been absent this entire time; apparently because she had been counted present with the Hokage! "Seriously, you guys are really gonna be late!" she warned.

For fear of blowing one of Tsunade's gaskets, all ninja in the room shuddered with anticipation and fear.
***

"Ugh... mpm... that was good."

An unfamiliar girl sat crosslegged at the head of the table opposite Tsunade. This unfamiliar girl was, most noticeably, quite large for a girl to have come out of an action anime. Starting from the top, this girl had a sort of powder blue shade to her brown hair, where the brown focused in the back and faded naturally to the color of a robin's egg. It was kept very long and in many tails; there was one big one in the back with two smaller ones directly next to it, which sat atop two ponytails that touched her rear bound together into a divided style. Her bangs were kept out of her face, mostly via clip, but a pesky strand of hair that always seemed to poke out had to be constantly readjusted and tucked behind her ear. Her face was beautiful, one of a china doll's given a few too many chins, and her skin had the matching texture of pristine pale; the life of pampering and avoiding anything even resembling work having paid off in its exquisite complexion. Her smooth skin rounded out over her made up face, done in traditional Japanese styling strictly for the meeting, and folded once to give the indent of a second chin. After that, her body fell to pieces. She had narrow shoulders caked in fat, her upperarms clearly defined as they tested the confines of her robe. Her stomach sat slightly away from her, almost as if on its own, as she leaned into her meal. Her bottom, grown wide from many years of posturing on plush objects, was thick and meaty; it bulged outwards even now as she sat atop the most comfortable pillows available to her.

Needless to say, Tsunade and Shizune were shocked to say the least. This woman was Lord Fuukuraida's daughter, his sole proprietor of his wealth but also the only biological inheritor of many powerful techniques. How had he, such an esteemed and proud man, spawned such a sloth?

"Well, I'm glad you liked it Lady Fuukuraida." Tsunade said happily as she signaled that her plate be cleared. "Please, you can just call me Sanada." she said humbly.

"Of course." Tsunade said daintily as she nudged Shizune under the table. She outstretched her palm, to the onlooking noblewoman it seemed like nothing more than nervous twitching, but Shizune's eyes widened as she read the descriptive death threats that the absence of their team warranted. "I-um, better go see where those kids are." Shizune said nervously.

"No need!" Naruto's brash voice came clamoring into the room first, as usual. Sakura promptly bonked him on the noggin, as usual. "Excuse us milady, but may we sit with you?"

"Of course!" Tsunade said warmly, take a seat, all of you!"
1221.title: Luncheon

choices: Alright, Lady Sanada's first day on the town with: Ino, Hinata, and Lee!
Or perhaps the first shift goes to Naruto, Hinata, and Sakura?
12211.content:
As directed, all six young shinobi took their seats around the dining room table. The Feudal Lady was already seated across from Tsunade, whose right side was filled with Shizune. At the entrance of the six young ninja, Sakura decided to take the seat on Tsunade's left side. Lee scrambled to take the seat to the right of her, but was cock blocked by a certain ninja in orange. Hinata did her best to work up the courage to even think about grabbing the seat next to him, but was herself foiled by the pale ROOT ninja Sai. Settling for second best, Hinata sat next to Shizune and Ino next to her. However once realizing that this would put her the farthest away from the cutest guy in the room, Sai, Ino quickly scrambled to take the empty seat next to the Fuukuraida heir and the seat across from Sai, putting Lee directly across from Naruto and a good gazing distance closer to his own crush, Sakura.

"Well, now that we're done playing musical chairs." Tsunade said, opening with an actual joke rather than her usual bitter sarcasm, "I think we should probably get everyone started."

The more observant of the tardy shinobi, Hinata, Sakura, and Sai, took notice of the fact that rather than waiting on everyone else to arrive the people present in the dining hall had already begun their meals prior to their arrival! Tsunade, Shizune, Ino, and the Fuedal Lady had already started eating! Aside from being rude, this act of indiscrepancy seemed to have occurred at least a good twenty minutes ago, judging by how little there was on everyone's plates. Except of course, for the esteemed Lady Sanada; whose already small amount of elbow room had been cramped with three discarded plates.This of course, was noted by even the bluntest of shinobi in the room. Even Naruto couldn't help but watch as this girl of no more than sixteen devoured her rations in a manner very reminiscent of his own! She didn't seem to acknowledge the arrival of her bodyguards quite yet, as she seemed so enthralled in finding the bottom of her plate. While by no means a messy eater, Lady Fuukuraida was far from the dainty eater that everyone had expected.

"Eh..." Naruto struggled to find words as he watched the strange display in front of him, he raised a wobbly finger to point at her, but he was met by a matching pair of punches from both Tsunade and Sakura; their fists meeting between Naruto's whisker marked cheeks. Hinata wasn't too concerned with the table manners of their guests, especially not when Naruto's mortality was involved. Her thoughts on the matter were just short of something actually insulting, but those would never be divulged to those around her. Sai couldn't care less, he was simply flashing his smile blankly towards the Lady. Lee was abhorred at such rudeness from one of such distinguished background before realizing that this must have been some sort of eating contest and she was already swelling with the results of how much she had eaten. And of course, not so surprisingly, Ino's opinion came out as little snickers and giggles at the young girl's expense.

It wasn't until after everyone was served that the Lady would stop eating, practically slamming her plate down onto the table and pushing it back with a heavy sigh of contentment. "Ah!" she groaned heartily, "I have to say, you've got some pretty talented chefs at your disposal Lady Hokage." Sanada said haughtily, "You have done an excellent job satiating my appetites."

"Great, 'chept we're theh onesh shtill eating." Naruto grumbled to himself through a thick mouthful of grilled steak. Sakura, hearing his derogatory remark, nearly broke his femur with the swift sturdy kick she delivered. "That's wonderful, Lady Sanada!" Tsunade said in the fakest voice possible, "Are you sure you wouldn't like to have a little more though, we have plenty." The royal girl thought for a second before turning the offer down, "No thank you, I wouldn't wish to make a glutton of myself in front of your ninja." Ino snorted, "Too late for that." she mumbled before she felt her toes crumble at the mercy of another of Sakura's kicks. "Anyway, um, why don't you tell us a little about yourself Lady Sanada?" Sakura said nervously as she desperately stretched her legs to keep everyone at the table quiet, "If we're going to be spending so much time together in the coming months, I think we should all know a little bit about you to make your stay in the Leaf Village easier!"

The round girl's ego having been stroked successfully, she smiled kindly towards the pink haired kunoichi. "Perhaps after dinner, young pink-headed girl." she said with a sort of social naivety that enraged said pinky, "After all, you are all still eating, it would be very rude of me to interrupt your meals despite my already finishing."

Sakura grumbled something rather derogatory herself, much to the amusement of the still-recovering Naruto, before diving back into her meal. After only a few more minutes, everyone was just finishing up, when Lady Sanada decided to speak not of her life story; but rather to excuse herself from the bathroom. The Lady hefted herself up, inadvertently revealing that she bore quite a rotund bottom and an overall pear shape, and waddled out the dining room and down the hall. It was at this time that Tsunade decided to level the playing field and start acting like herself again. Unable to bear any more food presented to her, she scooped the remainder of her third plate onto the similarly stuffed Shizune's and brought her arms to the table in her usual business manner; everyone could tell by her furrowed blonde brow that they were finally going to get the low-down on their ponderous plumper princess.

"Alright; for those of you who aren't very bright, that was Lady Sanada of the Land of Plenty." she said sternly, "Yes she's quite heavy, and no she doesn't like being reminded of such. On that matter: Naruto, Ino, keep your blonde mouths shut during this mission. Do not in any way, shape, or form, insinuate that she is overweight or you will regret it." both addressed blondes gulped slightly as the listened further, "That woman's father was Lord Ikeda Fuukuraida, one of the most wealth entrepreneurs in the Land of Fire. Recently he passed and left his entire fortune to his daughter, Lady Sanada. As such you six will allocate all time necessary to make sure that his daughter has an enjoyable stay in the Leaf Village."

"Sounds easy enough." Naruto said confidently

"You'd think that, of course." Tsunade said darkly as she silently commanded Shizune to finish what she had put on her plate, "Lady Sanada is docile enough, but you mustn't let her attitude fool you. She's a little sheltered, so keep any and all bad news away from her, and she's used to getting her own way. Do what and when she wants you to do, or she might not invest in the Leaf Village."

"Wow, she sounds really important." Ino piped up

"She is. Let me put it this way, if she chose to invest in our village, all the debts I have accumulated will be filled three times over." Everyone at the table let out the same amazed whistle, much to the chagrin of their superior, "Yeah yeah, that's a lot. Anyway, I spoke to her about living in the common house where most of our royal guests stay during their trips, but she seems determined to live in the city amongst "regular people". I can only post so many ANBU outside her door without her knowing, and unfamiliar guards rather than escorts might upset her."

"In short, I need you six to be the best friends that girl's ever had for the next six months."

Everyone had their own take on the matter. Naruto was, in a few words, "bummed because he would be stuck with this mission for so long." Sakura shared the same despair, but found peace in that she would have a lot more time to study with Tsunade. Sai was indifferent, it seemed to be just another mission to him. Ino was the most audibly remorseful, actually letting out a groan before being silenced by Tsunade's sharp glare. Lee took this with as much fervor as he did with anything else, promising to make this "the absolute best extended time that Lady Sanada has ever spent in a village that was not her own!" Of course Hinata was exuberant; red faced and blushing at the thought of spending so much time on a mission with Naruto.

The silence was only broken by Shizune's hurried eating before Lady Sanada re-entered the dining hall. "Excuse me, so what did I miss?" she asked naively, looking around and sending her ponytails back and forth. "Oh, uh, nothing!" Tsunade said in her resumedly fake attitude towards the girl, "We, were, um, just about to get another serving brought out."

"Oh good, I feel like I can handle a couple more plates now." Sanada said happily as she plopped her mighty rear down to the cushioned seat, "I'll have my servants bring up another serving or two for everyone before I dismiss them to your order, Lady Tsunade."

Both Ino and Shizune groaned, two plates for each would mean four and six plates respectively! They weren't used to eating this much! "Wait a second!" Naruto barked as he pointed towards his Hokage, "You get servants?! How come we don't get servants?!" He was silenced with another quick kick and a brash "Shut up, Naruto!"

"And I'm sure in these six months, they'll treat you and your adviser as well as they have treated me!" Sanada said merrily

Tsunade could only laugh nervously....
12211.title: Hospitality Between Villages

choices: They went by Choji's favorite barbecue place just as lunchtime hit.
Later Sanada sees Naruto at Ichiraku and she treats them to six or so bowls.
122111.content:
The next morning Hinata, Ino, and Lee all arrived bright and early in front of the address that Lady Sanada was residing at.

The three of them expected it to be a large house to suit it's incredibly large owner. They were unprepared for how expansive the property was, or how tall the residence seemed to be.

"A-amazing." Ino said quietly, "It's bigger than the Hokage residence."

"It's bigger than my family's home." Hinata added in a much less audible tone.

"It is an epitome to hard workers everywhere!" Lee shouted in sheer admiration. "To build such a massive estate in so little time takes true dedication. I have nothing but respect for whoever built this home for Lady Sanada!"

Ino and Hinata merely stared at the enraptured Lee. Ino's was one of annoyance while Hinata's was one of confusion. Eventually they realized that Lee wouldn't snap out of it unless they did something first.

"W-well why don't we go get Lady Sanada? I'm sure shes finished breakfast by now." Hinata said.

"Fat chance." Ino mumbled as she followed Hinata. A full ten seconds passed before Lee snapped back to reality and rushed to catch up with them.

They finally reached the door where Ino proceeded to ring the doorbell. None other than Lady Sanada appeared, looking as pristine as she was last night, only eating a single bowl of rice.

"Oh you're three of the shinobi from last nights dinner, correct?" Sanada asked. Once her fellow teenagers smiled Sanada grinned as well and performed a somewhat awkward bow. "Well allow me to reintroduce myself. I am Lady Sanada Fukuuraida, but you can call me Sanada."

"Ino Yamanaka." Ino replied blandly.

"I-I'm Hinata Hyuga. Nice to meet you." the main branch heiress stuttered.

"And I am Rock Lee, the Leaf village's handsome devil!" the taijutsu enthusiast replied giving both a thumbs up and a smile. The impossibly audible glint in his teeth made Sanada smile.

After the short conversation Sanada gathered her things and...
122111.title: Guarding a massive yet meek body.

choices: Sanada's day with Naruto, Sakura and Sai goes similar, but with lots more ramen!
Sanada insists on eating quite a lot, and its starting to show...
1221111.content:
...was escorted out of her temporary grounds by her three bodyguards.

Tonight was going to start off simply enough, so as not to overwhelm the coddled heiress, with a generic walk about of the village and two take-out meals of lunch and dinner to get her warmed up to Konoha. While Ino was sure that Sanada wouldn't be too enthralled with walking anywhere for an extended amount of time, an opinion which she shared moments before picking up said Feudal Lady in a hushed voice, everyone was pleasantly surprised to see that the girl was in relatively good humor about walking around the village. Rock Lee suggesting a handstand competition around the village wasn't met with the same fervor; but that was to be expected.

No, today was going to be an easy day of relaxation and fun. Something that most ninja don't get to do very often with all the maliciousness surrounding their lives, so they all vowed to enjoy it very much. It was a unanimous decision to begin Sanada's first day as a Leaf Villager to bring the portly young lass to one of the local restaurants so that they may congregate peacefully while banging out the dents in their schedule of Sanada's guided tour. Ino's ideas mainly revolved around shopping; so much so that she even forgot that they were supposed to be treating their client to dinner as well, and had to cancel her option of a jewelry store to make room for supper. As self-serving as Ino's plan was, Rock Lee's wasn't much better; his plans were to meet up with his sensei, Might Guy, and take her on a first-hand experience of the greatest dojos in town followed by an extremely hearty supper of super-spicy curry. Hinata seemed to be the only one with her head on straight about the idea, thus explaining why it seemed that she was the one who actually did her job of guiding Lady Sanada around the Village... albeit rather quietly

"And, um, this is the Shibusen, its, um..." she stuttered noticeably as her shyness overtook her, "Well, I haven't exactly been here before, but my cousin Neji says that the food is really good."

And, despite it all, Sanada looked interested! Granted, her tastes were a little above those of the common people and so she wasn't exactly enthralled all the time, but whenever Hinata decided that something was important or interesting enough that she should know it, Sanada paid as much attention to detail as possible! Her interest first piqued at the Ninja Academy, having never been to school with other children before. After stumbling across the park, Sanada audibly lamented on how she had never actually been to one for an extended amount of time. And finally, here, Sanada was the most vocally interested at the Shibusen. "So you come here to eat?" she asked, sounding rather entertained with the notion, "That's actually a novel idea, I would imagine that it saves you time rather than just ordering, um, 'take out'; would you mind if we stopped here for some lunch?"

Even though that was actually the plan, Lady Tsunade's words echoed simultaneously between each of the three shinobi; in that they should do anything and everything possible to keep Lady Sanada entertained, occupied, and above all happy. "Uh, sure, that sounds like a great idea!" Ino said in an over the top manner as she started towards the eatery. "Absolutely, no doubt our bodies could use a bit of a pit stop!" Rock Lee said in a manner liking to Ino's, though without any of the faux enthusiasm it entailed, and started after her. "Wonderful!" Sanada said with a happy grin, "I've never had the pleasure to eat in an establishment such as this, forgive me if I'm a little green...
***

"Yes, a third course sounds wonderful."

Sanada was "green" at the beginning of this meal, there was no doubt about it. It was made more obvious than ever when she waddled up to the cashier and placed her order there. Luckily Hinata and Ino were there to spare her the embarrassment and after many apologies, a proper waiter was sent to their table. Again, Sanada's naivety shown through when she had trouble even reading the menu, having no idea what and where to look for what she wanted; even uneducated in what classified as an entree, dessert, appetizer, and so on! In actuality, this was due to her luxurious lifestyle of pampering; she never asked for an entree, she asked for a sandwich, so on so forth. However everyone was there to guide her in the right direction and soon enough, she was ordering her own meals like a pro. Not that she had a problem with giving orders or anything.

Everything started simply enough with normal conversation about the most generic of topics. Rock Lee, ever the people person, began with his long life story and his inability to perform ninjutsu and how Might Guy took him under his wing and his extreme rivalry with Neji Hyuuga and how Naruto inspired him and how Gaara almost crippled him for life but how Tsunade saved him and so on, so forth. Needless to say, Sanada was a little frightened of such a dark life story; having never been desensitized to anything more than a friend of hers catching a cold. Ino swept in attempting to salvage the Lee-centric conversation with a little bit about herself, but it really just became a narrative on Ino's life so far from there. Sanada was a little less scared, but a little more uninterested. It was Hinata who had the bright idea to ask her for conversation, and she began very much like the two before her.

She explained about her father, Lord Fuukuraida, and his many interests; among which was diplomacy between large nations. This led to many partnerships between many villages all around the ninja world, the Leaf Village as a pivotal poll in whether or not his very own land could come to fruition. Thankfully enough, the then-Hokage Sarutobi was kind enough to vote for his cause of establishing the Land of Shore which eventually became the Land of the Plenty after many years of specializing in shipping, growing wealthy as a village, and a congressional name change proposed only six or seven years ago. Sanada then went on to tell her a little bit about her own life; her childhood and how her servants had always taken such good care of her, the few friends she could call her own, and of her recently deceased father. Pleased of the interest her personal life seemed to garner, Sanada turned her attention back to Hinata; thanking her for the kind words and interest she had shown her before asking about her own life: namely if there was a certain boy she liked, to which Hinata could only turn dangerously scarlet and thank the Hokage that their first course had arrived.

Of course, that was a whole two servings of full-course meals behind them now; and Lady Sanada was only just beginning. Prior to their second course, everyone seemed to rise at once as if they were making their leave. Sanada innocently asked if they all had to use the restroom, and if such, could she join the two women as she too had to partake. Everyone chuckled nervously, but went along with her for fear of upsetting the sheltered client. This led to seconds after a quick pee break and then later thirds. Normally no one would have even dared think of three courses on such a strict dietary regime, but the customer was always right.

Rock Lee; having the most crazy, whacked-out metabolism available to him due to his insane training techniques, wasn't too bothered. In fact, this was just a little bit more than what he usually ate to keep a suitable amount of minerals in his body. He ate with his usual energy and only slowed down after about his second course was over. Sanada too, was just a little past peckish after being starved. She had eaten all the complimentary sushi rolls provided to the party, plus the mints, and even regrettably the wasabi sauce after mistaking it for a beverage. There was no issue of her being full here. However, it was Hinata and Ino who suffered the most, having nor a crazy whacked-out metabolism nor an ungodly appetite. Underneath her purple and gray sweatshirt, Hinata's belly rose considerably as it swelled taut and hard in her indulgence. And Ino, who had made the grave misfortune to sit where Lady Sanada could see her, had eaten all the same, plus anything that her client deemed "oh you must try this" worthy and stuffed into her mouth. Both kunoichi were ready to burst, far beyond their natural limitations for food.

"Well!" Sanada said with a satisfied pat to her stomach, "I'm satiated fully, why don't we try going to one of those clothing stores that Miss Yamanaka mentioned earlier, I would so love to get some commoner's clothes!" she said excitedly as she attempted to unwedge herself from the booth, "And after that, why don't we take a nice visit to the park so Mister Eyebrows can show me those taijutsu whatsits he was talking about."

"Joy!" Rock Lee said exuberantly, "I will make sure to wait outside the women's clothing store diligently so that no one may walk inside to peep on such vulnerable women!"
1221111.title: An Enlightening (and somewhat worrying) Lunch

choices: Lunchtime at Ichiraku's! Wow, she and Naruto nearly bankrupt the place!
To the Hokage! Lets see how Tsunade and Shizune are handling being pampered!
12211111.content:
No one quite understood what Ino meant when her explanation of their first day out with Lady Sanada; especially not when she warned them about how much she liked food. The poor blonde seemed sore all over, and feverish; almost like she was ready to collapse after her long day with Sanada. However she came back with a new outfit and a stylish pair of bar earrings on Sanada's treat, as she mentioned to Sakura an umpteen million times during their post-mission conversation, so things couldn't have been too unbearable. Sakura had to admit, she wasn't really looking forward to her day out with Lady Sanada.

Well, that wasn't entirely true. She was looking forward to spending time with the obviously socially reserved heiress. Sanada looked like a really nice girl, one that Sakura would get along pretty well with once they got to know each other. Plus, it helped that she was getting a big mission payment, but that wasn't who Sakura was nor had it ever been. What she wasn't looking forward to was a long day out with Naruto and Sai. Sure it was funny for comic relief in hard times, and Naruto was really a sweet guy, but the two of them together- personalities clashing as they usually did- was just a little too much to bear; especially when someone as sheltered as Sanada into the mix, things had a tendency to get pretty hairy. Of course Sai wasn't nearly as socially awkward as he used to be, maybe there was still hope for this little rag-tag Team 7 and Lady Sanada after all?

Anyway, so just like the day before Sanada was met with her personal squad of escorts that would, as predicted, escort her royal rump around town. From everything that had been gathered in the mission report from the opposite squad formed of Ino, Hinata, and Rock Lee, her day was spent exploring the centermost region of town. No accidents or mishaps reported, aside from a mostly mutual lack of fervor and morale. Rock Lee even seemed somewhat... less psychopathology energetic after his day out with Sanada. Though, granted, Naruto did catch a glimpse of Rock Lee on one of his rigorous walks around the Leaf Village while handstanding. So there really wasn't any telling just what was up with Ino and Hinata; or their mysterious Lady Sanada for that matter.

It was Sakura who had the brilliant idea to rotate their individual responsibilities regarding their Lady's security; instead of taking it quite as leisurely as the first group. Naruto, as the one with the shortest attention span, wasn't very observant towards the matter. Not so much dismissive, but it just simply required too much attention to watch every single movement that his overstuffed client took. Attention that was required to make her trip to the Leaf a fun one, so he decided to leave the analytical stuff up to Sakura and Sai and had the last rotation that required outside observation. Sai, being the least social and least attached to the mission at hand, decided to take watchman's post and remain somewhat aloof at all times, only taking the position of full-time tour guide when both Naruto and Sakura had exhausted their turns. As a girl who was relatively easy to talk to but still quite observant, Sakura would take middle ground and fill in spaces left by both positions.

But it was really a hard job keeping up the three separate jobs, especially when Lady Sanada asked so many questions at one time. And when she started remarking on the strong, physical build of both Sai and Naruto, it was pretty hard for them to stay out of the conversation as her chubby face grew red with innocent attraction. In short, she was just a people person! It was hard to ignore her!
12211111.title: Whiskers, Pinky, Flamey, and a Fatty

choices: Skip to Tsunade and Shizune's pampered dinner where Sakura, Sanada, and Lee join
Back to Sakura, Sanada, and the others.
122111112.content:
Tsunade gave a great belch as one of the many servants Lady Sanada had brought with her pressed deep into the stuffed leaders belly. Shizune, her own body stuffed by all the wonderful food they had been given, looked aghast at her mentor.

"Lady Tsunade! Apologize!"

Tsunade just shrugged and picked up some leftover chicken from her plate, munching happily.

Shizune sighed and was about to try again when Shizune let her own loud belch escape her, courtesy of the belly rub she was receiving. The belch was even louder than Tsunade's and the assistant blushed.

"I'm so sorry!" Shizune said, but the servant merely smiled, rubbing Shizune's belly again and handing a cookie up to her mouth. Shizune bit down, enraptured by the taste of the treat.

In fact, both Tsunade and Shizune were looking downright fat, their bellies softer, their butts taking up more and more space beneath them, and their thighs touching, to say nothing of their rounder faces.

And this was only lunch!
122111112.title: To the Hokage! Lets see how Tsunade and Shizune...

choices: Wasn't hungry and secretly gave his bowls to Sakura so Sanada wouldn't be upset.
Began to eat, but noticed some stranger in the shadows.
1221111122.content:
Around that same time Squad seven and their super sized guest had arrived at the scenic, iconic, and maybe overly used Ichiraku ramen stand.

"This is the best place in Konoha Sanada, Ichiraku Ramen!" Naruto said as he sat on his usual stool and smiled while rubbing his hands together greedily. Sanada had to sit on two seats, one for each size of her gigantic rump. Sakura sat opposite of Sanada, and Sai was stuck standing.

"The ramen here is that superb?" the rich teenager asked. Naruto nodded vigorously just as the propeitor, Teuchi walked in. Sanada was the first to greet them. "Oh hello sir."

"Hi there miss, are you another one of Naruto's buddies?"

"Yeah, this is Sanada Fuukuraida. She's an important client from the Land of Plenty. I wanted her to try some of your ramen Teuchi."

"Really? Well I think I'll thank you by giving the first bowl to you free of charge." the cook said as he gave them all some ramen.

"Thanks!" Naruto cheered before hastily digging into his ramen and almost inhaling it. Seeing his fervor Sanada decided to take a bite of her own and she instantly fell in love with it. The flavor, the texture, even the warmth of the dish was just so perfect!

"It's wonderful!" Sanada announced, practically sitting on cloud nine. "Mr. Teuchi, please allow all of us to have two bowls in each flavor, I'll pay however much it costs."

The old man practically heard angels singing and saw an imaginary beam of light hit Sanada. He had prayed for a rich customer like Naruto, but never dreamed that one would appear. He could feel himself swimming in all that Ryo!

"C-coming up right away!" he said before hastily departing and returning with several bowls of his refined soup. Naruto and Sanada were eating at the same pace matching one another bowl for bowl, whie Sakura ate as much as she could so not to upset Sanada.

Sai...
1221111122.title: There can only be one! (Ramen style)

choices: Oh wow, lets go check this out!
12211111222.content:
...meekly started pecking into his dish with the fervor that a mouse has with catnip. It wasn't that he didn't enjoy ramen, he came here plenty of times with Naruto to have at least developed a taste for it. In fact, just about anyone on Team 7 had been dragged here so often that they could all had become quite the aficionado of the noodle dish. Sai was pretty sure that somewhere, even the native traitor Sasuke had trouble even looking at a bowl. But what had kept him from so readily digging in was his trouble balancing his two duties of escort and lookout.

He balanced the chopsticks on his foremost fingers, unamused and relatively bored with the mission... of course he wouldn't say that; according to several of his books on manners and social etiquette, it was considered rude to openly disagree with what your friends thought was fun or necessary. Besides that, it seemed pretty stupid to openly dis the mission altogether, since there was no doubt in his mind that Sakura would wail on him so hard he'd be in a body cast for the next month. From what he had gathered about Lady Sanada already, it was plainly obvious that she was relatively harmless. From what background statements on the Land of the Plenty had gathered, it was a peaceful middleman between villages of all countries; so any attack on it or anything causing a disruption would be almost equally harmful to villages of all nations. So, that being said, an attack on the heiress hoping to cause a panic didn't seem very likely unless it was from one of the very few villages, towns, or companies so in-affluent to afford a contract with the Land of the Plenty. In short, her father's wet fingers had pretty much sealed Lady Sanada's safety.

Still, that didn't do much for his predicament now, did it? He was still stuck here while all the really important missions went to waste. No matter, he might as well smile and bear it like usual. He took an obligatory slurp and turned back to his client and friends for a moment. "Sai, if you wanna sit down, I can get an extra stool for you or something." Teuchi said kindly as he washed bowls in the back, "I mean, you just look silly standing there halfway under those flags." Sai smiled, "No thank you sir, I'll stand." he said in that couldn't-help-but-sound-fake tone of voice that most of his declarations came out as. It was true though, he'd much rather stand so as to get a better look at the ever-so unlikely chance at attack. Of course, he didn't have to worry.

Yep, the skyline that rose above the dinky shack that was Ichiraku's was just as safe and assassin free as could be. There was a large building right there in front of Ichiraku's, still had no idea what it was or who was in there, right next to another building that came up just a little shorter than the first one.In fact, the stand seemed to be surrounded by tall buildings, probably so as to make it stand out all the more. Anyway, a quick scan over all those windows would prove fruitless; there wasn't anyone in there. He couldn't feel any other chakra, but that wasn't really his talent anyway. To get a better look, Sai discreetly conjured up an Ink Bird to scan the tops of the building.

"What was that?" Lady Sanada asked, her head rising from her bowl

"What was what?" Naruto asked, "You alright?"

"Yes, I just felt... oh never mind, it was probably just a gust of wind."

Sakura kicked her pasty-faced partner as he stood. Obviously a sign to be more careful. So, with that out of the way, Sai was more than happy to congregate with his client and teammates for a while before the scout came back negative. And for a while, he was considerably more happy to be in the conversation; but felt a little left out as to his late arrival to it.

Sanada, Sakura, and Naruto were having a very similar discussion as the one Sanada partook in yesterday with her alternate escorts. One of backstories and personal information, the kind of drama that Sanada came to find rather interesting. Since she had never done much of anything with her own life, she got a real thrill out of hearing the exciting adventures of her new shinobi escorts. She, of course, started out with Naruto; she seemed to bond with him pretty easily. His story wasn't exactly the whole truth- more like a watered down version for a more sensitive audience- but he got the point across that, while he had hard life, he stayed relatively plucky and joyful. He went on to explain his stories from his youth, his early adventures with Team 7, and exaggerated exploits in a way that required lots of hand gestures, improvised sound effects, and left his ego stroked by the amazed expressions on Sanada's round, doubly chinned face.

"Hee hee hee." Naruto giggled as he thought himself the most awesome guy around before a swift face punch knocked him back down to size. "That's totally not how it happened, Naruto." Sakura said darkly. Surprisingly enough, Sanada giggled wildly at the abuse of the fox-faced boy... much to his disappointment. "Sanada! Whose side are you on?!" he barked, pointing his chopsticks at the heiress. "Oh, excuse me." Sanada said unconvincingly through her snickering, "I, um- are you alright Whiskers?" Heads turned at the adorable nickname. Naruto turned to Sakura, only to find that she was biting her bottom lip with a bright red face and a cheeky expression. "Whiskers." she choked the word out before completely letting loose in an onslaught of laughter. "What the hell?!" Naruto barked back, "Sanada, my name is Naruto Uzumaki; not whiskers! Na-roo-toh!"

Sanada, still giggling, tried her best to explain herself. "Yes, well, according to this book that my friend Uryu bought me, I am supposed to give according nicknames to my friends to show that we are close with eachother." Now where have we heard that before? Oh yeah. Sai couldn't help but ask; it turns out that they had the same book! "You see, so I named you Whiskers because of the marks on your cheeks that, well, look like Whiskers!" she touched to said birthmarks with a hammerspace pointer, nudging a comically unamused Naruto's cheeks in the process. "That's hilarious." Sakura and Sai said plainly. "SHUT UP GUYS!!"

Suddenly, Sai felt that his scout had disappeared. The chakra connected to it was severed. "Um, excuse me, I have to... use the bathroom." he said suddenly. Said shinobi discreetly passed a note to Sakura before retreating to an unseen position. She read it to herself: "Sakura, trouble, I'll send a scout if I need you, Sai... PS: eat my bowls, don't want Sanada to get upset."

"Oh great." Sakura said flatly as she peered over at the massive pile of uneaten ramen Sai's negligence had caused...
12211111222.title: Lol. Whiskers. Oh wait, what's that?

choices: Later that night, its girls night out.
Elsewhere, a certain stalker is watching Sanada, and planning to take her!
122111112221.content:
Sakura sighed in annoyance. Sai was shirking a part of his responsibility as a member of Squad 7, but the pink haired girl had to focus on downing all that ramen despite being halfway full and still having a couple bowls left. Still she had to eat quickly and inconspicuously. It would be no big deal for Naruto because it meant that there would be more food for him, however Sanada might feel like her efforts to befriend Sai weren't working, and if word got to Tsunade they were all in for an earfull.

Sakura decided to eat as quickly and efficently as possible, chewing the noodles enough for her to gulp them down easily. What helped was how the ramen was delectable enough to encourage her to have more despite her ailling belly. Still she was filled with a strange contentment after downing several bowls, making her actually want more and wonder if Naruto ever felt like this.

Speaking of the blonde with a devil in his belly button, he was starting to like Sanada a little more. Aside from his less likeable nickname and the fact that she was at least as big as Choji she was a pretty nice girl, and cute in a way. Still Naruto was more focused on his food.

Sanada and Naruto were still neck and neck when Teuchi returned, this time with his daughter Ayame.

"Sorry, but that was the last of our stock folks." he said, looking proudly at Sanada. "I never knew that there was a girl who could eat as much as Naruto, thanks for bringing her by Naruto."

"Eh, it was no big deal. I do it for all of my friends!" Naruto said, which made Ayame giggle.

"Is she a special friend?" the previously fattened girl asked (see the anime, she actually gained a fair bit of weight for an episode). Naruto wasn't quite sure what Ayame meant by special, but Sanada was blushing even more than before.

Just as Sakura began to wonder where Sai was he reappeared.

"Thanks." he muttered to Sakura as he stood in his old spot.

"Don't mention it." Sakura muttered.
122111112221.title: Sakura's stuffed!

choices: Uh, yeah, so lets spice things up when one of the girls spots an enemy scout....
Nope. Just food. Lots and lots of food for our ladies here... yep, food...
1221111122211.content:
Due to conflicting mission scheduling and a lacking in common interests, the kunoichis of Konoha never really got to hang out all together very often. Sakura was always one for a good night out once in a while, but she had more important things to worry about like training with Tsunade and keeping her teammates in line. If she was slack just one day in either situation, untold catastrophes could occur that would endanger the lives of others. Hinata was always way too shy about everything, she didn't really go out with anybody except Kiba and Shino. And even then, things were pretty tame. Ino, however, had long been looking forward to a day out with her girlfriends. Choji and Shikamaru were great, but not when it came to the ever-necessary day of feminine entertainment. Sure enough, this was going to be one epic night of girl's only fun.

Ino Yamanaka was the one to suggest the whole thing; she and Sakura met up on the bridge after Team 7's go around with Lady Sanada and gave a quick exchange of opinions about the girl. "I think she's really sweet." Sakura said after a quick two person guffaw at how much their roly-poly client could consume. "Yeah, but that's only because she is what she ate: lots and lots of sugary crap thats bad for you." Sakura gave Ino a quick, though crippling, jab to the arm. "Ino! That's terrible!" Sakura reprimanded the pony tailed blonde, "Lady Sanada is a really nice person, you could use a little bit of that yourself!" Ino rolled her eyes, "Oh come on Sakura, Lady Tsunade's not around, you don't have to kiss her ginormous ass." she said dismissively, "Sanada just needs to loosen up a little, have a little fun for once in her life." Ino continued, letting her cheek fall into the groove of her open palm as she leaned on the bridge's railing. "Well, she's never going to get another chance if its not here." Sakura said after a bit of silence. Ino wasn't a very complicated person; she was actually concerned that Sanada might get picked on because of her weight. If memory served, Ino had done a very similar thing for Sakura's forehead...

"Why not tonight?" Ino said suddenly, that mischievous look painted dead on her face, "I mean, three out of four of us are free for the next six months, counting that fatass we've got four girls- one of whom is loaded- and an infinite amount of shops and stuff to do!"

Maybe Sakura was wrong about that last judgement of Ino's character. "Ino, I don't think Sanada is really ready for tha- Hey wait a second, you just want to get her loose with her money!!" Sakura hollered as she delivered another one of her killer punches to Ino's arm. "Well maybe!" Ino said teasingly, "But you've gotta admit Sakura, all that girl needs is a good time, and she's never had anybody to do it with; the timing's perfect!" Ino said slyly... Sakura could only agree with that. "Alright, but no more making her buy you stuff." Sakura said sternly, "We're supposed to be guarding her, not sponging off of her."

"That's quite a lot to sponge-

"INO!"

***


"Ladies' Night!!" Ino Yamanaka shouted joyously into the night sky as she led her three comrades about the hustle-and-bustle city of Konoha. It wasn't exactly Tanzaku Town, but the Leaf Village had plenty of things to offer up for four young women with time to spend. The enthusiasm faded slightly when Sakura proposed a budget on tonight's expenses, so as to not blow all their cash in one blow. Ino whined and complained, but they settled on a moderate budget that would satisfy all four of the girls. Hinata wasn't saying much, and neither was Sanada; this was their first girl's night out ever and Ino was kind've scaring them. But, never the less, things eventually got started with a simple trip to a standard restaurant to act as base for said night of feminine fun.

A late dinner (second dinner for some, the Hyuuga household ate rather early) was only the start of one of the best nights of Lady Sanada's life. Sure things started out a little awkward, but now that she had been around the village a bit, Sanada was inclined to make some observations from her rather innocent perspective; some of which the girls just had to find funny. That opened up a myriad of conversations; a good majority of which leaning towards Lee's freakish bodily features. They had lots of fun together and grew really close- and that was just before their meals arrived!

As their waitress slowly brought several plates to the young women's table, Sanada looked at it with a sort of awestruck manner. "Oh wow, this just looks fantastic!" she said in amazement, reaching for her utensils so that she may dig in heartily, "I had no idea such good food could come from anywhere but my homeland!" Ino snickered, and she thought Hinata was sheltered! This girl had no idea what went on outside her bedroom! How drole! Of course, the minor distraction of food stopped nothing at the table. Their corner grew loud with laughter, mostly the buxom blonde's doing, and even got the young Hyuuga heiress to blow her swig of beverage out her nose! It was simply a great time to be had by all. However, as things died down a bit, mostly due to the raging headaches fueled by their incessant laughter, Sanada's appetite kicked in and she was ready to start actually eating. To think, the food in front of her had actually gotten cold!
1221111122211.title: Ladies' Night

choices: Two weeks pass by, and Sakura hasn't found anything suspicious about Romi
Something has come up; and Sakura challenges who Romi claims to be.
12211111222111.content:
Click. Click. Whirl. Click. One table away from where the Kunoichi and their charge were sitting and having the time of their lives, a girl in her late teens was busy rapidly pressing and spinning the sides of a metal cube that resembled a traditional puzzlebox. The girl had pale skin, brown hair and eyes of a similar color that were obsucred behind a set of round and rather opaque looking glasses, and was wearing currently wearing a black kimono with white swirls located in various locations across the silk fabric that looked rather tight around the girl's midsection. Granted, the bespectacled girl's belly was nowhere near as big as the one Lady Sanada was sporting, but it was deffinately noticeable.

Whirl. Click. Click. Click. The brunette manipulated the box's intricate and artfully made moving parts, the motions of the inner mechanisms giving off a sound that practically defined a complex design . As the conversations between the four exuberant females died down for a little while, as the heiress' attention finally returned to her food, the girl sat the box down on the table for a minute and gave her fingers a moment to relax.

"Waiter," the burnette hailed down a passing employee.

"Good evening miss," the waiter turned to face the girl politely. "What can I get for you?"

"I'll have the full rack of boar ribs. Oh, and for desert, some vanilla icecream would be nice."

"Of course miss, your order will be ready shortly," the waiter gave a quick bow, before leaving for the kitchen to have the order processed.

Click. Whirl. Whirl. Click.

---------------------------------------------------

A telegram-esq machine was quickly alternating between rapidy stamping a variety of simple shapes onto the sheet of rice paper below it. The device was currently sitting on a small desk towards the back wall of an undecorated room with no windows; giving anyone who entered the building the feeling that they were underground somewhere. Sitting infront of the machine in a large plush chair was woman who looked to be in her mid-to-late twenties. She had jet back hair and eyes, pale skin, and looked to weigh easily twenty pounds heavier than Lady Sanada currently was at the least. She was also wearing a kimono of similar design to the one the brown hair girl in the resturaunt currently wore; only in addition to that kimono, she also wore a ninja-village headband dipicting a mouth filled with sharp, animal-like teeth. Standing next to her was a blond woman who was slightly slimmer than the one who was sitting; though not by mutch. She too wore the same headband and black kimono dotted with the occasional white swirl, only her's seemed to be tearing at the seems slightly; it was evident that she would need a new one similar rather than later.

The machine ground to a halt for a moment, prompting the standing individual to pick up the sheet covered in random shapes and began translating the message to her obvious superior.

"Romi has a confirmed siting on the heiress. She is under full time surveillance by a rotating team of six Leaf Ninja. Five chunin, one ANBU special forces member. Amongst the body guards is one Hyuga Hinata, first daughter of the famed main branch of the Hyuga family- another potentially high value target, my lady. Romi is currently on standby awaiting you're orders"

The heavier woman smiled to herself, causing her round face to dimple slightly.

"Tell Romi that she is to make contact with the heiress and her assigned guards. She is to befriend the group and insure that they don't suspect anything while those missing nin we hired prepare for the eventual abduction. Tell her to stick with cover story A; and remind her to match the Land of Plenty's regional dialect perfectly should the "Lady" feel a bit homesick."

The blond woman reached over to the machine and began striking a series of keys; all the while the dark haired woman began sinking into a deep thought.

"Soon, you backstabing old man, you will pay. Wherever you're retched soul might be rotting now, know that the Land Of Promise will be avenged. It will rise again; and all you're hopes and dreams you had for your homeland will be destroyed."

-------------------------

Click. Click. Click. Whirl. Whirl. Click. Whirl.

The metal device was now rotating on it's own. Turning dozens of mechanical parts in unison as Romi rapidy scribbled down the response on a napkin that had been smeered slightly by vanilla icecream. After a few minutes, the device ceased to grind it's gears together, and the pudgy ninja quickly went to work deciphering the various blotts of ink she had made. In only a moment, she knew what had to be done. Fortunately for her, the four girls were still in the resturaunt; only now preparing to leave and head off to their next destination. Immediately, the bespectacled girl switched into the role she was to play and began sprinting up to the departing party.

"Oh! Oh! My Lady!" Romi said with all the enthusiasm of a rock enthusiast catching sight of their favorite band member.

The group of four paused and immediatedly turned to face the approaching voice.

"Why hello!" The jovial Sanada said with cheer; still elated from the time she was having with her newest friend. "Yes, it is I, the beautiful Lady Sanada- but who might you be?"

"Oh! Yes. Pardon my manners. My name is Romi Kato. My father works at our nation's embassy in the Hidden Leaf Village. I-I had heard that you were in town and I was hoping that I'd have a chance to run into you and-"

"Woah, woah, woah," Sakura said curtly, cutting the bespectacled girl's excitement down like an ax to a very loud tree. "You just happened to be at the same restaurant and at the same time as we were?"

"Yep. Pretty lucky, huh?" Romi responed with a perfectly practiced smile and nod.

"And you didn't notice the leader of you're nation until now?"

"Nope!" Romi responed with an over-eager shake of her head.

"Oh come on, Sakura- don't be so nosy," Sanada said with a grin; some of Romi's enthusiam over their little meeting clearly transfering over to the Feudal Lady.

Sakura let out a resigned sigh. "Fine, I suppose I am being a little to harsh. Look, uh, Romi, we were just leaving and-"

"Oooh! Oooh! Can I come along with you guys?"

"Absolutely-"

"Of course!" It was the Lady's turn to do some cutting, and this time it was to Saukura's belief that this job was begining to be enjoyable. "The more the merrier!"

"B-but Lady Masada!" Sakura tried to protest. "We know nothing about this girl-"

"So? I didn't know anything about you guys a few days ago- and we're already great friends! Besides, I'm sure a few ninja like you could handle the daughter of a diplomat if she became to mutch of a hassle."

Sakura angerly smashed a palm into her face, leaving a bright red mark that was clear for everyone to see. God, it was aggrivating how trusting Sanada was. Well no matter how fast she decided to invite strangers to come hang out with her, the pink ninja was determined to keep careful watch over this upstart fan of the tuby heiress.
12211111222111.title: Infiltration

choices: Sakura goes to Hinata to ask for help.
Sakura goes to Sai to ask for help.
122111112221111.content:
"And... checkmate!" the chunky heiress said as she stood up and cheered, spraying bits of riceball onto the checkered board below.

"Oh wow! I honestly thought I had you beat! You're amazing at this game Lady Sanada!"

"Why, thank you Box!" Sanada replied with a glowing smile. "You're not so bad yourself! It's just that I have so much time on my hands back home that playing chess is practically all I did before coming to visit the Leaf Village."

Sakura let out a weary sigh as the feudal lady and her hanger-on began cleaning up the third "oh, just one more game, please?!" that had occured before they left for their usual afternoon of sightseeing. Every day for the past two weeks Romi had shown up at Sanada's safehouse with an impossibly wide grin plastered on her face; and every time she showed up Sanada would insist that she be allowed to spend the entire day with them. More to Sakura's dismay, the bespectacled girl and the feudal lady had quickly become really close friends- as could be clearly seen by the fact that Sanada had recently nicknamed Romi after the girl's obsession-level need to fiddle around with that metal puzzle box of hers. Sakura couldn't help but think about how awkward "Box" was for a nickname, but if it bothered Romi at all, she made no indication of it. However, the nickname the pudgy burnette had recieved was the least of the pink-haired ninja's worries right now. She couldn't put her finger on what exactly seemed odd, but Sakura continued to feel off about Sanada's fanatic of a follower. Sure, her story checked out; Sakura had tracked down the Land of Plenty's official embassy in the village and found her name listed on the roster of the staff members easily enough- and yet she still couldn't bring herself to trust her.

"Hey, Sakura!" a high pitched voice belonging to a certain blond ninja suddenly hijacked her train of thought and crashed it into a metaphorical rock, causing her to suddenly refocus in back on reality. Waiting for her by the door was the aforemented Naruto, along with Sai, Sanada, and her favorite sychophant, Romi.

"Maybe Sanada's right... Maybe I am being a little too nosy..." Sakura thought to herself as she moved to catch up with her friends. Afterall, she had been closely watching the burnette from the time she joined up with them when they were about to leave the resturant several days ago; and overall she seemed relatively harmless, if a little too eager to be spending all of her time in the heiress' company. And, judging by the size of her gut, she likely couldn't put up much of a fight in case she needed to wipe the floor with her for some reason.

Overall, the day passed by as uneventful as the last few had been. They started off by taking her to see the massive carvings of the past Hokages that overlooked the entire city- which quickly devolved into Naruto talking non-stop about his dream to one day become Hokage for almost an hour. Since they had gotten a pretty late start thanks to Sanada's little chess session, she suggested that it might be a good idea to stop for lunch- an idea that was immediately supported by Naruto and, unsurprisingly, Romi as well. What Sakura did find surprising was that Romi, while still being significantly thinner than Sanada was, managed to match her plate for plate whenever they stopped in for a bite somewhere- no wonder she was getting fat. Though it wasn't like Sakura was one to talk, as her own red outfit was feeling rather tight around the middle as of late. Unable to refuse eating the inumerable ammount of food Sanada invited her to have at the risk of possibly offending her (not to mention incuring the wrath of Lady Tsunade in the process), she had forced herself to overeat with the feudal lady whenever she had too- and by the look of a small tear that had occured in her shirt fabric recently, the affects were starting to show.

"I have got to find away to get around this," Sakura thought to herself as she rubbed her stuffed stomach on the way out of the resturant. Their assembled team was still slotted to serve as Sanada's guards for another five months or so, and if she had to continue to eat like this for that long...

"Oh hey, what's that over there!" Sanada suddenly said as she pointed at a nearby poster that had been haphazardly tacked onto an otherwise featureless fence.

"It's a notice informing everyone that the summer festival is set to begin within a week, and will last a total of three days" Sai said matter-of-factilly.

"That sounds exciting! I've never been to a festival without Father and his assistants watching my every move."

"You mean you haven't been to a party since you're dad passed a way?" Naruto added in to the conversation

"Nope. The servants at the castle were too afraid that I might get hurt- but with you guys around, I'm sure that I'll be fine!"

Crap. Sakura had forgotten all about the festival; being far to occupied with her role as the heiress' escort to even remember one of the biggest celebrations of the year. If anyone was going to attempt something, it would be when the streets were flooded with people and it was all to easy to get seperated from one and other. The realization suddenly brought the issue of Romi's pressence to the forefront of the pink ninja's mind. She had to find something to either put her mind at ease or confirm her suspicions before the festival started; otherwise she was sure that something bad would happen. Only problem was, she had failed to convince herself on the issue either way, maybe if she had someone's help, she'd be able to find more conclusive evidence and finally be able to reach a mental verdict on the pudgy hanger-on.
122111112221111.title: A Nagging Suspicion: A Devil Hidden in Plain Sight

choices: Throw a private dinner party here, I'll have the home field advantage
I'll see if I can take them around Konoha to eat, that might disorient Romi
1221111122211111.content:
That evening Sakura decided that the best person to help her find out more about the mysterious Romi would probably be Hinata Hyuga. Even though Sai was better at overall espionage, Hinata was far better when it came to appearing to be friendly when it was needed (or at least her timidity was a far better substitute than Sai's social awkwardness), not to mention her talent with the Byakugan. Currently Sakura was at the Hyuga residence and was explaining her concerns to the lavender heiress.

"But Sakura, how're we supposed to find something that will tell us whether or not Romi isn't trustworthy?"

"I think her box might have a hint, but I need you to keep an eye on her for awhile to be sure. I'll try and set up something where you can watch her, if you get caught pretend that everything's normal."

"O-okay." Hinata agreed, "But what are you going to plan?"

"Well I'm going too..."
1221111122211111.title: Sakura goes to Hinata to ask for help.

choices: Hinata goes in and attepts to aprehend Romi (potential epic ninja fight.)
It's a trap! Someone attacks Hinata from behind.
12211111222111111.content:
"-going to invite everyone over to your place tonight!"

"W-what? M-m-my house?" Hinata's jaw practically fell off as the heiress visibly recoiled from the suggestion

"Yeah, sure. Think about it for a moment. If Romi really is up to something, she would have already gathered as much information on the town as possible- where the best hiding places are, what the quickest escape route from any given area might be, or which places have the loosest security. We can't try to spy on her while she visits Sanada's house because she's already seen the layout of the house and probably knows where someone would hide out. Not only has she never been to your house before, but look around- your place is huge! If we keep hounding her, there's no way she'll be able notice all of the little siderooms and trapdoors your family has installed, and we'll be able to keep our eyes on her without running the risk of getting caught."

Hinata regained her composure. The pink-haired ninja had made several persuasive points. Still, Hinata kind of felt that Sakura was taking her help for granted by deciding on using her house to carry out her plan in without first asking her if it was okay. However, insuring that the feudal lady was protected at all costs was more important than any slighted feelings she might have about being occasionally used as a metahorical doormat for her friends to walk all over, and Hinata quickly agreed with the plan Sakura had proposed.

"A-alright, it sounds good. B-but how do you know that Romi will even show up?"

"Leave that to me," Sakura said with a sly grin.

------------------------------------------------------

As Sakura expected, Lady Sanada was all too willing to accept an invitation to the party. Also as expected, Romi looked nervous for a split second upon hearing the news, but quickly recovered her usual psychophantic smile and tried to convince the feudal lady that eating out on the town was what she came here to do; afterall, she had spent her entire life eating in stuffy manors and really should spend as much time as possible enjoying what urban life had to offer while she had the chance. The tubby heiress of course was far to excited by the prospect of spending more time with her friends to take notice of the bespectacled hanger-on's words. Once Lady Sanada was on board with the plan, all it took was an offhand comment about how "box" should come too, and the heiress practically bombarded Romi with peer pressure until the chubby burnette agreed to come.

When news of the dinner party reached the ears of the rest of Sakura's teammates, they all reacted with various degrees of excitement. Rock Lee, of course, responded with as much enthusiasm as he did with almost everything; even slightly more than usual as a matter of fact, as normally his friends "forgot" to inform him of any non-work related social gatherings. The promise of a free meal was all Naruto needed to hear, and readily agreed to come just as quickly as Lee had. Sai, and surprisingly, Ino, took some ammount of convincing before they too agreed to join them at the Hyuga residence tonight. When Sakura asked why the normally extremely extrovered blonde girl would be reluctant to attend any sort of party, she only managed to turn red from embarrasment and mumble under her breath. For unbeknownst to the pink-haired ninja, Ino had actually outgrown her formal ware; something she found out the hard way only a few days ago.

"Look, I'll be there," Ino said with a depressing sigh. "I'll-I'll just be a little late."

---------------------------------------------------

"H-hello, Lee," Hinata said with a soft smile on her face "Thank you for coming."

"It is my pleasure Hinata!" Rock Lee said; once again proving that the taijutsu master really had no concept of what an indoor voice was.

Hinata merely nodded and let the local workaholic walk inside. Arriving shortly after Lee was Naruto; it took all of Hinata's willpower not to faint on the spot at the sight of Naruto entering her home. The very idea made her red in the face, and Sakura wisely decided to intervene and let the Hyuga heiress cool off while she greeted the rest of the guests. The orange-clad ninja was quickly fallowed by Lady Sanada and the "guest of honor" Romi, who expertly mirrored the feudal lady's excitement at visiting the household of one of the most prestigious clans in the hidden leaf village. About an hour later- far after Sakura had expected anyone else to show up, another knock came from the front door, and the pink-haired ninja excused herself from the current retelling of whatever amazing feat that braggart Naruto had managed to pull off to invite who ever it was in.

"Hey, glad you could-"

Sakura's words died mid-sentence as her eyes fully took in the sight infront of her. Here was Ino- normally someone who was so obsessed with looks she wouldn't dare go outside unless she deemed her reflection to be perfect, showing up at the door looking like she just got dragged through a bull pen. Her new kimono (which she bought a few sizes to big for her to try and hide her recent weight gain) was smeered with mud in several places, her hair- normally in a neat pony tail, had come undone, and now lay freely sprawled out behind her, and finally, it looked like she had applied her make up on using her left hand, as it had obviously smeered while it was being applied.

Normally, this would be a cause of concern for someone like Sakura, but the image in front of her, coupled with the girl's longstanding childhood rivalry, was too much for the pink haired ninja to bare, and she immediately burst out laughing.

"Wow Ino!" Sakura managed to say through the fit of laughter. "What happened to you?"

"Look," Ino said with an indignant look on her face. " I was running late a lot longer than I thought I would be, so I tried to get here as fast as I could and on the way here I tripped and fell into a really muddy puddle."

The blue-eyed ninja shuddered as she remembered the "tragic" event. Thankfully, Sakura was kind enough to let her in without any more jokes at her expense. Since it was clear by that point that Sai wasn't going to show up, Hinata showed everyone over to the dining hall for the main branch of the family, where a rather impressive variety of food and drink was waiting for them. After undergoing their usual competiton of who got to sit next to who, which once again ended with a dissapointed Hinata sitting as far away from Naruto as possibe; and, as coincidence would have it, right between Lady Sanada and Romi. The pink-haired ninja hadn't exactly fared well this round either, as she had somehow wound up in between both Rock Lee and Naruto, leaving Ino as the odd man out and forcing her to sit at the far end of the table away from everyone.

"Well, this is great," Sakura thought to herself. This was going to be a very long night.

As soon as everyone was seated, Lady Sanada immediately grabbed a spoonful of the nearest dish and began pilling food on to her plate, with everyone else following suit with a much lower (or in Romi's case an equal) level of zeal. Hinata was rather surprised that the much smaller Romi had an appetite to match that of Sanada's, matching her plate for plate long after everyone else had slowed down or stopped entirely. The Hyuga heiress herself managed to pack a good four plates away, as she was far too distracted with trying to observe the bespectacled girl to her left to notice how much she was eating. It was only after Hinata felt a sharp pain in her middle did she come to realize exactly how much of a pig she had made of herself.

"Oh, dear..." Hinata's face went red with embarrassment "I hope Naruto doesn't notice..."

"Whoops," Romi suddenly said as she spilled a part of her drink onto the black fabric of her kimono. "Excuse me, I should go clean this up. Which way to the restroom?"

"It's through the lefthand door, down the hall, and three doors to you're right" Hinata said.

Moments later, Sakura drop her fork and make a big effort over getting another one- this was her cue to follow Romi and see what she was up to. Discretely, the Hyuga heiress got up from her seat and slowly made her way towards the side room she and Sakura had picked out in the event that Romi decided to go hide in the bathroom. Once inside, it took little time for her to build up a little bit of chakra.

"Byakugan!" Hinata habitually said to herself as the veins around her eyes suddenly rushed to the surface of her skin. Immediately, the walls surrounding her became clear as glass, and Hinata saw the puzzle box being held up in the bespectacled girl's hands. Only she wasn't the one moving it. It was moving on it's own; and making clicks that were very similar to...

"A communications device!" Hinata said with a shocked look on her face.

1311.content:
"Ahhh...that hit the spot!" Ino proclaimed after her latest meal.

The cook was Mrs. Akimichi, Choji's mother, who smiled at the compliment and patted Ino's stomach.

"I'm glad you like it! Your figure is really improving Ino!"

Ino smiled at the comment for a few moments before realizing what exactly that meant. Looking down, Ino was shocked to discover a big belly. Of course she knew most of the weight had to come from all the food she'd just eaten, but still it was a surprise.

Ino was about to inspect further when a voice whispered in her ear.

"Mom's food is good, isn't it?"

Ino looked to her right to Choji, her boyfriend, and nodded.

"Sure is. But Choji...do you think that...I'm getting..." Ino was too embarrassed to finish the sentence, prompting Choji to nudge her.

"What's wrong Ino?"

The caring look in his eyes made Ino forget her worries for the moment and she just shrugged her shoulders.

"Nothing...just acting weird I guess. What's for dessert?"

But even as Ino said this, she placed a hand on her stuffed stomach, wondering if she was doing the right thing by ignoring her weight gain...
1311.title: Ino eats alot thanks to her new relationship wi...

choices: "Then move in with me!" Sakura says gleefully, "You can help me so much!"
"Then watch what I eat!" Sakura says "Eat my portions so I can lose some weight"
1312.content:
Ever since that deathlock between Sasuke and Naruto, Sakura hadn't quite been herself. Normally "not quite herself" meant a little spacey on missions or just general mopiness. She was prone to do that. But this was a different kind of mopiness, the strange disappearance of both former team mates of Squad 7 was a hard blow on poor little Sakura. She had described the event perfectly, when she wasn't bawling, and it was plain to see that Naruto had taken onto his own style of training in order to win Sasuke back from the clutches of revenge. This disappearance of one of the most important people in her life was crushing, but not impossible to remedy. However, one bad day with Tsunade and this new mopey attitude left Sakura with an ultimatum; "People die in the battlefield, Sakura; you can lose anybody you hold dear in a split second. I realize you're upset, but if you can't focus, then your place isn't by my side or as a medical ninja..."

In short, it was either perk up or pack up. Unfortunately the former far outweighed the latter and Sakura was left with no choice but to end her training with Tsunade. After the War, Sakura had been the one to watch first-hand at the fighting between Sasuke and Naruto; it tore her up inside to see Naruto fighting to bring Sasuke back to her. Ironically enough it was just to see her happy. But it left her desolate and miserable. Both sides were lost and taken to their respective corners for a miraculous healing session. It would take forever to recirculate Naruto's chakra points.
