And since Sakura hadn't learned that technique, there was no way that she may ease the pain of her fallen comrade while he lay in the hospital bed. No, it seemed that this blossom had shed its last pedal of usefulness.

"Oh my GAWWWWD!!"

Sakura bawled heavily as she shoved yet another hamburger into her mouth. So far, this had to be at least the twenty-second. You can understand how hard it was to keep track of things like that. The pinkheaded girl sniffled and whined before opening her mouth wide again for the second half of the burger. She barely chewed, all she did was inhale! It was nuts! All those feelings deep down inside of her were being stuffed down with food! Burgers, pizzas, dumplings, barbecued meat; it seemed that enormous quantities of a myriad of food weren't enough to fill the deep hole left in Sakura's heart... but that didn't mean that she realized that.

Over the months things began to change in Konoha. The trees that Yamato had laid as the village's foundation had come into full bloom when Naruto's Nine-Tailed chakra form swept through the town. Buildings made of wood prospered and flooded the land. The recently revived citizens seized life like never before, the local businesses flourished, and there was always a foreign diplomat here to celebrate the healthiness of the Land of Fire. The people grew stronger and hardier like never before; all inspired by Naruto's drive and determination. There was even talk of Lady Tsunade stepping down and opening up a healing center within the town so that Naruto may become the next Hokage... assuming that he gets better.

Something else, though only if you carefully observed the phenomenon, one could see the steady inflation of Sakura Haruno. In the rebuilding of the village, there were plenty of buildings left unclaimed; Sakura insisted on moving out an into one of these buildings soon before the tragedy. As the weeks passed, one more observant could see the increasing amount woman that went up into the house. Loud sobbing was heard almost nightly amidst a television blaring and the constant rustling of snack packaging. Occasionally the obscenely loud belch would reach the neighbors.

And that was all that was really left of Sakura Haruno. There was pity for her at the beginning, but it slowly faded as those closest to her lost hope.

But for now, it was her last chance. Ino Yamanaka, her best friend since they were little kids, had agreed to taking her out to eat. Of course, she hadn't actually seen Sakura in almost a year now, and she was a little wary when Kiba advised her that she should "bring her checkbook.". Of course now that she was seated across from the one-woman pity party, Ino completely understood.

Sakura hadn't put on worry weight. She hadn't been eating out of distress . Sakura was just eating; and a lot by the looks of her. Ino could just tell that this immense lump of blubber wasn't her friend; the way she stared blankly at everything and the constantly tired look on her face. She seemed dull and unintelligent, among other things. She wore a strapless dress that tightly hugged her overlapping backfat, it allowed her stomach to billow out and rest heavily against her thighs. And her massive, tray of an ass was wide and wobbly. Completely out of control! Her triply chinned face was blank, though she seemed to perk up when she stuffed nachos down her gullet.

Ino, kept relatively the same since the war, was pretty much disgusted. She rolled her eyes as she sat across from this gluttonous pink pig, said porker stuffing herself without abandon. She blew the large singular bang out of her eye in contempt. Ino was so disgusted even think to look twice at her dessert; warning labels paled in comparison to the prime example sitting right in front of her.

"Eat your dessert." Sakura said sadly

"I'm just gonna go."

"Why not?!" Sakura suddenly hollered, "Everyone else's left me! Tenten, Neji, Naruto's in the hospital... I'm just... I'm just lonely!" she whined as her mass slid downwards in her booth seat, "Lonely and fat..."

"Look, Sakura, I just don't want-

"Eat the dessert, Ino!" Sakura said, now frantic and close to tears, "Oh, what, you don't wanna wind up like Sakura Haruno, do ya?!"

"Just shut up, Billboard Brow!"

The name seemed to call back a bit of Sakura from before; she grimaced a little. "You look here, we've all watched you sit on your ass for how long now, a year?! And all you've done is mope, cry, and eat. Well look at you now, you're a big fat pantload, and you've got to stop!" Suddenly, the spark of Sakura was gone as her face flooded with tears. "I-I know! I know that!" Sakura cried, "Its just, I-I need help! I need Naruto to get better! I need to get back in shape; I know I need all those things, but I can't do them alone!"

She broke down crying once again, right there in the middle of the restaurant. Needless to say, it was pretty awkward. "Look, Sakura, I could always help you out. We're girlfriends, that's what we do!" Ino smiled as she held the blubbering whale close, "I'll always be there to help you out. Always."
1312.title: The Fall of Sakura Haruno

choices: The next day Sakura's trying hard, but no success. Ino rewards her anyway
After a month of failed attempts, Ino decides to help Sakura "cheat" using jutsu
13121.content:
".......Are you serious?" Ino asked. "Me move in with you?"

Sakura sniffled and nodded. "Y-yeah, it can't hurt...Besides you can make sure I don't eat too much and help me excersise. You are pretty fit."

Internally Ino beamed. Being coerced by flattering words and the sad-yet-precious look on her friend's face she had made her decision.

"Okay, but there'll be a few changes."

A week later Ino had finally moved into Sakura's house and was already working out a diet and excersise regimen.

"The first step to living happily is living healthily." Ino told Sakura offhand as she began writing down activities. The oversized girl in red was chowing down on leftovers from Ino's moving in celebration. All of it was takeout that Sakura ordered and practically begged for Ino to let her keep. Right now the chubby teen was nomming contently on some dango.

"I thought the first step to a happy life was having a boyfriend?" Sakura asked as she moved onto some miso soup. The blonde girl nodded in agreement.

"Yeah, but you gotta be in shape to catch a man...Usually. Anyway tomorrow we're going for a jog bright and early. After that I want to see if your jutsu skills are still good."

"But Ino that's a lot of work!" Sakura whimpered, "Can't we take it slow?"

"Nope. But tell you what, I'll let you go out to eat two times a week if you stick to this routine. Of course I'll be cooking otherwise."

"Okay...So can we go out to eat tonight?"

"NO!"
13121.title: Ino's big move!

choices: Ino tricks Sakura into meeting with Naruto
Ino visits Naruto herself to get some aid.
131211.content:
The next day, Ino had made sure Sakura was up bright and early so they could head over to the training grounds to start up a new training program for her overly plump pink haired friend. It took some coercion to wake up the girl, but with a hearty breakfast and a promise of a nice dinner, she begrudgingly rose from her comfy bed and put on some workout clothes, consisting of sweatpants that fit poorly due to her massive backside, and a long sleeved top that rode up and showed off her plump pale belly. After doing some morning rituals, the two made their way to an out of the way training ground, Ino's reason being that Sakura could use the walk and the fact that she didn't have to embarrass herself in front of any potential passerbys. After a rousing half an hour of Sakura complaining and moaning about doing physical work, they had finally arrived in the clearing, the surrounding area covered with trees, a few stumps and a few training dolls as well.

"Well, we're here. Want to do a few warmups first before we start?"

"L-Look, I'm still not sure about this, why can't we start off nice and slow?" asked Sakura, placing a plump hand on her wide forearm out of nervousness. Letting out a sigh, Ino placed her hand on Sakura's shoulder.

"This is nice and slow. Trust me, we'll have your kick-ass bod back soon enough alright?" With a nod, Sakura agreed and Ino had led her into some stretching.
---
About an hour later, Ino simply gave up. A combination of Sakura's unwillingness to actually work out a bit, combined with the humid weather had lead to the platinum blonde to simply call it off for the day and let Sakura know that she did 'really well' for the first time. If any consolation, the walk back and forth was at least something physical that she did. Finally arriving back at her apartment, Ino was not shocked in the slightest when Sakura began to make herself a meal, using the 'healthy' ingredients Ino had bought the other day. With a sigh, Ino simply threw herself into the shower to wash away all of the sweat and small tears that she had amassed at the botched training session. After the long and hot shower, she changed and sat herself down next to Sakura at the couch. Eating a sandwich and glaring at the television intensely, Ino tried to think of anything that could convince her to have a bit more self control. A small idea gleaming in Ino's mind, perhaps she could get her to address the route of her issues.

'Naruto.'
131211.title: Tired Tried Triad

choices: Ino is honest and tells him the truth
Ino decides to downsize Sakura's weight
1312112.content:
The next day, Ino had managed to sneak herself out of Sakura's apartment on the promise that she was out shopping for a nice and 'hearty' meal later that night. It had only been a few weeks since she had seen the other blonde, he was well on the road to recovery and was looking quite healthy. The initial incident had left him quite scarred and injured and his chakra network was one giant mess. It it wasn't thanks to the Kyuubi perpetually maintaining his body that he was able to slowly recover a near unrecoverable injury. Tsunade projected that within a few weeks he could be released, provided he didn't get himself mangled by the anger-prone Hokage with another one of his little escape tricks. It was only around a ten minute walk to the hospital and Ino used the time to think of what she was going to say to the blonde. If she informed him of Sakura's current state, she would expect him to rush out of that room to see her in no time flat. If she downplayed it too much, then he wouldn't think her current situation was a problem. Still thinking over this 'little' problem, she reached the hospital and was allowed visitation to Naruto's room. Reaching his door, she knocked on the door and entered.

"Hey there Naruto, how you doing?" she asked with a smile. Naruto, surprised to see that Ino had visited, flashed her a wide toothy grin. Examining the room, Ino saw that it had changed little since the last time she had visited. There were still the plants that she had given him to take care of on the windowsill to alleviate some of his boredom and there were a good amount of scrolls and books on his dresser that served a similar purpose.

"Ah nothing much, just excited for when I can start up my serious training again." said the blonde, flexing his arm which still had an impressive amount of definition to it. "So what brings you here? Something up?"

"Ah yes, it's about Sakura..." she began, feeling that it would be best to lead him on a bit. She did feel slightly bad when she saw the panicked look on his face. "Calm down, it isn't anything to worry about that much."

"Well what is it then? Does she need my help?" he asked, his blue eyes shining with concern. Come to think of it, the pink haired nurse had only visited him once when he was first admitted, maybe it was related to that?

"Let's just say she's put on a bit of weight..."
1312112.title: Worry Worries

choices: Ino begins to enjoy this little vacation a little too much...
Free Choice- because I'm not quite sure what could happen other than that...
Free Choice- because I do so hate to waste a chapter option
1313.content:
Diplomatic relations between the Hidden Villages and smaller factions that littered the Ninja World have always been a delicate matter. Being the more powerful, Hidden Villages were looked up to with a certain amount of respect; not only out of courtesy, but out of fear. If, at any time, a Kage were to ignore decency and show out to the other Village Leaders by slaughtering a town and its inhabitants, there was little to be done about it. Kage's will was law, and shinobi were dispensable hardened killing machines who used the very forces of nature to carry out their mission. Fortunately enough, those elected to lead their villages were usually more levelheaded than that. Thankfully, when troubles were roused, it was usually the smaller villages attacking their dignified leaders- having about as much effect as a mosquito on a bull elephant; annoying, but nowhere near frightening enough to cause a panic.

In the desperate need to feel recognized or taken seriously, many small groups of ninjas formed over the years decide to present their case to a nation's capital and wait approval for recognition as an honorary "Village Hidden in the-" title. More often than not most submissions were rejected. It was at times that most would-be shinobi would take a hard look at themselves, train intensively and sculpt their skills so that they might be inserted into a crappy filler arc where they would show animosity to the slapped-together Leaf Squad, undoubtedly containing the ever-present main character of the show, and slowly be inspired by him and become friends. He then would go back to his Hokage and plead and beg with her until the Village was recognized as legitimate and all was right with the world. However, seeing that said whisker-faced goon had left the village with his trusted older gentleman companion for a three-year long training session, that wasn't much of an option. Instead, times got desperate for those looking for exposure.

A small group of ninja, having already seen the marvelous handiwork of Naruto and his friends and inspired by their camaraderie and natural talent, decided that the Leaf Village was a wonderful place for them to set ground on being a legitimate Village; having already been rejected by their home nation of Lightening several times in the past. So they sent a squad representing their best and brightest to show the Hokage that they were willing to not only leave the Land of Lightening but also offer their valuable services. They were, after realizing just how useless a Cooking Ninja utterly was, shot down like a duck with the hunting rifle that was Tsunade's sharp disposition.

Wait a second, did they just say Cooking Ninja? As in the same cooking ninja that kidnapped Teuchi's daughter? They wanted to join the Land of Fire? The short answer is, in that order: Yes they did, yes that's them, and wanted would be the optimum word. After feeling the sharp sting of defeat, instead of sucking it up and taking it like the fully grown men and women that they were, they resorted to angry threatening and complaints to try and sway the powerful Sannin's opinion. This was met with Tsunade literally punching one of their so called "best and brightest" out the window of her office. That's a long drop, one that scared the other Cooking Ninja into submission. So they left disheartened and angry. Having been at least smart enough not to send a letter of confederacy to the Village Hidden in the Clouds before they were accepted into the Leaf Village, their people's homes for generations were at least safe from retribution of angry Lightening citizens.

However, their feelings were still quite hurt. They longed for the plentiful landscape of the Leaf Village, finding their cooking much more fruitful when it was made of the supplies from here instead of the savannah-esque conditions of their homeland. It made more sense that they should be allowed a place here, where their talents would not go to waste on such harsh lands. And, gosh darnit, they wanted security from those monsters that roamed the neighboring islands! To feel better about themselves, the remaining Cooking-Nin decided to, while they were here for the night, just go whacked-out crazy with some of the best sake in the Leaf Village. Anything they did wouldn't be noticed until after they left for the Land of Lightening, and they were at least notorious for not letting outsiders punish those within the country's borders! They could do whatever they wanted as a payback- and of course, their drunken little minds made sense of this little plan...

***drunken kidnapping, lots of screaming from the now-sober ninja once realizing just what they've done, "Can't turn back now", cross borders with abducted genin***


"Dish ish...-chomp- rully good!" a young girl's loud voice says as she fills her mouth with a large amount of steamed antelope meat. "It doeshn't look like it would be...-smack- but you guysh are rully talented!"

Their captive, one Ino Yamanaka, was fully aware of her situation. There was no genjutsu placed on her, or some other ninja BS, no mind control, no matter how sweetly ironic it would seem considering her talent for brain-hopping into people's bodies, or anything else terribly cliched. She knew full-on that she had been kidnapped, taken from her village family and friends, on her way back to the flower shop after making a quick delivery to the Haruno house. Her captives had explained themselves several times and felt completely terrible about the entire predicament, even going so far as to assure her that she wouldn't be harmed by any of them or the other villagers. After hearing the whole story Ino was completely sure that her kidnappers were morons, alcoholic morons at that, and was sure she wasn't in any danger. At first she plotted getting back to the Leaf Village, but found the Land of Lightening just as inhospitable as the paragraph above stated. There was no way she'd get there on her own, and the Cooking Ninja weren't exactly keen on the idea of escorting her into a village that was no doubt blaming them. They'd die, every single one of them, slow and painful deaths at the hands of Inoichi Yamanaka- her father, and a damn scary ninja with lots of legends about him and the ShikaCho part of his team -as well as the rest of the village.

What were some kidnappers to do? Make the best out of a bad situation.

They promised their ponytailed captive that, despite her title as such, no harm would come to her. They offered her the best hut in the village and to be treated to anything her little heart could desire. This meant cooking her meals, wrangling up some more clothes for her and then washing them once they got dirty, and generally everything else that would make a day at the spa look like a spit in the face. Deciding that since she was due for another vacation sooner than she was due for another long mission with her team mates (which would actually be today, had she had not been captured), she agreed on staying in their village for a while- at least until rescue forces came or an agreement was met between the two forces. As, if the Leaf Village openly crossed the Lightening border without permission (something they were not too keen on just handing out, being a feisty nation) it would be an act of war. Avoiding war was good, and Cooking Ninja knew that above all else. So, in short: vacation for Ino, hopefully Land of Fire citizenship for Cooking Ninja. Everybody wins except for the friends and family worried sick about poor little Ino.

So, back to where we left off; Ino sitting in her plush bed in her new hut in this strange village eating servings of delicious food brought to her by her very apologetic abductors. As usual, dressed in her purple ensemble sans the stylish wraps around her midsection and the armbands, she looked like the very poster child of comfort. Of course, while on vacation, one was taken to indulge a little in the customs of the people. How bad could that be in a civilization that revolved around food? After all, it beat barbecue after every training session with Choji and Shikamaru. Some diversity might just be what her palette needed...

And, trembling from the waist down, one brave Cook-Nin stood in front of their "captive" and braved the situation. "N-N-No ha-harm will come to her, Lady Tsunade." a grown man trembled like a baby, knowing full well that this tape was going straight to a woman who had sent his best friend soaring out of her office not even 48 hours ago, "B-B-But we'd like for our demands to be met. We await your answer, as does Miss Yamanaka...sorrypleasedon'tkillme"
1313.title: Not Exactly Stockholm Syndrome...

choices: Find Sasuke and win him over!
Use the cooking Nin to overtake the Cloud Village. It's a win-win on both sides.
13131.content:
Meanwhile Ino was lying back on a veritable mountain of pillows and scarfing down the latest delicacy made by a cadre of Cooking Ninja. It was some sort of steak slathered in a special kind of sauce. The taste was indescribably decadent and yet it was hardly enough.

"Idsh amashing, bud idsh nod enuff." she said munching down several helpings at once. "Go ohn and make moar."

"B-but Miss Yamanaka, we've used almost all the ingredients. At this rate we'll run out." said one of the braver guards.

"Oh really?" she asked after finishing her last scrap of food. She gave that one cooking ninja a rather threatening glare. "Well maybe I'll just tell Lady Tsunade about you starving me when I go home."

Everyone cowered. Despite Ino's protruding round belly, fattened calves, and triple chinned face showing that she was hardly starved the cooking ninja knew that as a hostage she had more credibility in the blonde alcoholic gambler's eyes than a bunch of cowardly chefs.

"Uh...Ok w-we'll just make something else for you!"

"Something tastier?" Ino asked, or rather demanded lest her servants suffer.

"Yes! Right away!" the cooking ninja said before scurrying away from her.

Ino chuckled a little to herself before laying back on her plush tower and inspecting her body in a nearby mirror. To be honest she somewhat resembled Lady Fortune from another filler arc that Ino would rather not remember considering she was nearly smooched by an obese idiotic Elvis Presley rip off. The main difference was that Ino's fat was less shapeless and more well placed.

Her excess fat had culminated in her feminine curves defining them more than covering them. Her most prominent feature being her round, large ass. It was nice and large from all the sitting she did now of days, but her bust and larger protruding stomach were also immense. Although usually Ino would berate herself for getting so plump she figured it was worth it considering how great the food was. Everyday her serva- er, captors would make her food and fill her ever growing gut while she was pampered. Still that would get boring.

While she fully intended for the cooking ninja to continue to feed her Ino wasn't going to just waste her time being all alone. She was a talented, willful, and beautiful kunoichi (if you ask her) and she had to accomplish something!

The question was what would she do exactly? What was worthy of miss Yamanaka's time, effort, and attention?
13131.title: The birth of a titanic tyrant

choices: So they have wished it...
131312.content:
In all actuality, it would probably be unfair to give Ino credit for this magnum opus of a plan.

As she had during the course of her incredible gain, Ino was contentedly cratering the plush mattress with her ponderously swollen posterior as she merrily scarfed down whatever wasn't ceramic bowls or chopsticks that happened to be within an increasingly puffy arm's length. She, as per norm, dug in with ravenous gusto- her stomach long stretched to contain the ludicrous amounts of food that found its way down her throat. Her mouth spread open and wide, she somehow managed to stuff a hearty amount of rice and beef into each chubby cheek before choking the whole down loudly and repeating the process. Occasionally she would grumble something threatening regarding her "lack of" safety towards whoever might be in earshot, or when the mood strike her throw out an honest-to-goodness compliment, but for the most part the only sound that filled the tent was the contented sound of Ino's gorging; something of a cross between a quiet moan of pleasure in each bite and a squeal- topped off ever-so-slightly with a whetting of her now pouty lips and a sultry "Hrrrumph" when she managed to fill her tank.

It wasn't so much that Ino was a fan of being so greedy and gluttonous, as evidence had never pointed us towards that conclusion in the past. In fact, deep down there was certainly a part of her a little wary about such dramatic overindulgence. It was really the lifestyle that attracted her- food or no food. It was the deeper meaning behind the food, if you will. She had always been a bit of a Daddy's Girl, albeit a somewhat more brash ninja-y version of what comes to mind, so the concept of a little pampering wasn't too far gone to be believable. And in a village pretty much centered in the ways of the Culinary Arts, what other way was there to be pampered other than obscene amounts of cuisine? In a way, yes, these poor helpless Cook-Nin were slowly killing the once proud Leaf Shinobi with kindness, but there was definitely no part of her that didn't enjoy it. Her needs were met every day, she was well fed and coddled, it just seemed to bring out the inner prima donna in her naturally; and in whom wouldn't it?! So the more they brought, the more she ate. And the more she ate, the more they brought; so on, so forth until it was less of a "they bring, she eats" arrangement and more of a "she demands, you bring, she eats" autocracy.

Now this wasn't to say that she had become some sort of ruler to these people in the short time she had been "captured". That would be completely undermining the Cook-Nin's rule. In fact, very few of the Cooking Ninja knew that Ino was even back there- swelling and growing unrecognizably fat -due to the very shame that the leaders thought it would bring upon the clan. They were secretly just hoping that this entire ordeal would just go away as soon as possible and they could ship Ino Yamanaka back to where she came from, all being forgotten in the process. However as the weeks became months and pounds became inches atop their captive's frame, it seemed to become much more of a pipe dream. As the days grew longer and Ino grew wider, the five Shinobi who kept this growing secret from their clan slowly began to give up hope on ever getting word of amnesty from Lady Tsunade and the Hidden Leaf Village...

It was during one of these hopeless days that it happened.

At first, again, nothing usual. Ino sat atop her enormous rump amongst her many blankets and pillows- saddlebag thighs and swollen rear flaring out from underneath her sitting shape as it fought to stay inside a once-loose kimono -while the leaders brought her platter upon platter of delicious food. Now of course, this food was nearly orgasmic to those with even the most typical of culinary palettes. But Ino, having been spoiled by much better, could only swallow it down as if it were a live cockroach; she knew there was far better for her to eat in this stupid camp. Slowly setting the tray to her side and dumbly wiping her mouth with the squishy back of her arm, Ino took a deep breath and let out a nearly contented sigh. Nearly contented.

"Ugh..." she moaned, visibly straining to turn her neck to face her captors, "This ishn't...-swallow- the best you've got, right?" she asked indignantly, "I mean, like... I've gotten way better meals than whatever was in that Bento Box before."

It was at this, that the youngest of the five (a dark-skinned woman who, had it not been for the special circumstances at play, would have lost her temper a long time ago) inwardly fumed. Actually, a little bit of outer fuming occurred along with it. She nearly lunged at the portly princess for one of her prized recipes being called a Bento Box. Considering the sheer size of it, the similarities between the two should be incomparable! She was held down by the senior-most chef in the room, who seemed to take criticism much better than his pupil. "Of course." he said gruffly, "The customer is always right, of course." he said in a very professional tone, "However our current situation should be kept in mind when you hand out your reviews, Miss Yamanaka." The kind girl that she was, Ino could only turn her head slightly at the morose way he seemed to say the word; "Situation?" she parroted innocently, "What, keeping me up?"

There was a congregation of clearing throats, whistling nervously, and innocent humming.

"Y-You see," the elder began, "Before all of this started, there was plenty of food to go around for everyone in the clan. We, of course, got first serve so as to keep ourselves strong. Then came the women, children, hunting class, the working class, so on so forth, and things had worked out like that for quite some time." He then stepped forward slightly, "However, in light of... recent events and their appetites... we've been forced to cut food costs so as to meet your... growing-

"To keep you happy, we've had to sacrifice almost all of our reserves!" the youngest piped up, "Honestly, what was so hard about that?! You just say it, and its done!"

Ino looked down, pinching an inch of her fat bottom between her forefinger and thumb, "Perhaps I have... gained a little weight from all the food I've been eating..." she said, ironic in all sense of the word because as she peered past her incredibly swollen bust to see her fat ass, her third chin was almost visible in her craning neck position. "But what's the big deal, can't you guys just ask for more supplies from the Raikage?"

"No... Raikage A, he has denied financing our clan for years now." the one on the left to the eldest said matter-of-factly, "Its one of the main reasons we wanted to join the land of fire."

Ino, somehow finding an unattended stick of dango to occupy herself with, absentmindedly munched on her treat while lamenting, "Oh gosh, thash too bad. You know, my clan ish all about mind tekneekeshs. I betcha if I could -gulp- get into his head long enough, I could get him to sign that contract and you could get all the money you wanted!" she said innocently, "I mean, I could get him to say that you were the official Chefs of the Cloud Village or something... and poof! That's it. You're official cook people..." she scratched her puffy cheek as the other ninja in the room looked to her as if she were the Holy Grail herself. They congregated quietly amongst themselves, practically drooling at the mouth, before turning back around

"M-Miss Yamanaka, c-considering that you're obviously going to be here a while longer, though we by no means hope so, a-and assuming that you're willing andnottoooutofshapeforninjutsu, do you think you could... do that?"

Ino's big blue eyes blinked for a second as she processed their request, "G-Gee, I don't know... I guess, but... Lady Tsunade always said not to-

"Of course we'd reward you handsomely for your efforts!" the quick youngest interjected, "Y'know, with our specialties cooked to their prime!"

Ino's tummy rumbled loudly, despite her recent filling. More food definitely sounded better than starving out a village to feed herself just the same amount. And it probably had to do with some moral stuff too...

"You betcha!" she squealed, "Ooh, I'm drooling a little, go get me some napkins and... hmm... maybe a few cookies?"
131312.title: A Higher Calling, perhaps?

choices: Proceed to phase two!
1313121.content:
The next day the heads of the Cooking Nin held a meeting to discuss the plan involving their oh so daring mission to temporarily brain wash the Raikage and give them greater ingredients for their exquisite calorie ridden meals. It would be difficult to pull this off considering that collectively they knew practically no practical jutsu and their captive was in...Less than prime condition. Even so they were going to risk it.

After a week of planning the Cooking Nin strode into the Cloud Village as if they were holding some sort of parade. Ten of the cuisine shinobi were struggling to pull a huge float which had a giant covered platter on it. In the forefront some of the Cooking Nin played a catchy tune while others drummed poorly.

Many of the villagers watched the spectacle. Some amused and glad for a bit of liveliness, and others a tad surprised to see the offbeat ninja back in the village.

Confidently they strode to the Raikage's manor, where a few guards appeared.

"What business do you Cooking Nin have throwing an unwarranted parade? And why are you here?" asked a burly looking dark skinned man, sounding like a stereotypical musclebound minion. The dark skinned female chef from before, called Natsume, was chosen as spokesperson for the cooking ninja.

Slowly she smiled and bowed.

"We've come to show our good will to the Raikage through a grand feast, served by his humble subordinates." she explained, "We promise we mean no harm."

As the guard looked he saw a the platter's lid lifted to reveal a veritable mountain of food beyond comprehension. It was no wonder the carriers looked so tired.

Sighing, he spoke.

"I have to check, but it should be ok."

"Excellent. Thank you sir." Natsume replied smiling as she went to close the lid. Secretly Natsume smirked, glad the genjutsu that she cast worked.

As the guard watched the lid open she had cast it, making Ino appear as food. Some time passed before they were let in.

Now it got tricky!
1313121.title: Initiating the plot.

choices: Shocked, A can only listen; the Cook-Nin become important dietary staple in Kumo
A calls those chefs back to pick up their fatty.
13131211.content:
The Raikage Palace, not unlike the one that Tsunade stayed in back in the Land of Fire, was completely unlike the one that Tsunade stayed in back in the Land of Fire.

Apart from being just plain crazy-nuts in exterior design, the Kumogakure palace was truly a marvel of physical structures. Built into the side of a mountain, along with most of the Lightening Village's architecture, the capitol building extended upwards and outwards in a conical fashion- resembling something of an upside-down seashell or perhaps an ice-cream cone. Blue in color and bronze in trim, the cone extended upwards until it rounded out slightly at the top, where more foliage was fashioned into a sort of 'fro for the giant building. And crowning the structure was another tower, curiously taking on the appearance of the Ohio Space needle towards the tip. Below and around, the village flourished and went about its daily business, doing its best to put the awkwardly assembled Cooking Parade out of mind as it clumsily lumbered its way into the palace.

Oh, about that. Its probably worth mentioning that in order to get up to this building you are required to basically climb a mountain. So, with that in mind, one could imagine just how hard it had to be for the six wannabe shinobi lugging around almost 21 stone of cumbersome Leaf Ninja blubber, only about two of which knowing just what was in their presentation to the Raikage. The others, now inside, simply walked along beside their comrades in a perfectly symmetrical fashion, keeping sharp for anything that might stop their plan. The village elder and his two most trusted disciples kept bells on their toes as they nervously peered from side to side, relishing the awkward glances from the occasional Cloud jonin wandering the palace. Inwardly they panicked at every slight bump inside their offering, easily losing faith in Natsume's genjutsu skills... which were shoddy at best.

So, after what felt like a million steps (a quite possibly accurate estimation, regarding just how ballzoff crazy this building really is. Seriously, go look it up.) Those poor overworked cooking ninja were about ready to call it quits and go home, except that meant that they'd have to make all those infinity-plus-one steps again. Whatever food was inside must have spoiled by now due to the heat, magical cooking shinobi or not. But no, everything smelled just fine. Ripe even. Like the hotter it got in that platter the better. Being made of only the most valuable materials at hand (usually kept in reserve for special occasions around the village) it was practically a glorified sauna in there. Ino's now soft spongy skin wasn't used to even the slightest of discomforts, and she was dying in there! Her soft, flabby body was just going to give out if she didn't get something to eat- quick!

Finally, finally, they made it to Raikage A's door. They did all that panting, overworked people could do at this point: pant, wheeze, and weakly knock on the Raikage's door. Their leader, a ginormously muscular man with stark-white hair and crazy eyes who was (of course, as I'm sure we've all read the latest manga) shirtless and glistening with the sweat of a long day of training answered the door, looking very much like he was going to thank these wonderful citizens for their meal by biting off their heads and viciously raping their bodies. Of course, he didn't. He just sort of grunted, his frustration at developing his Lightening Armor clearly showing in his inhospitable nature, and gestured the cart in- having long been paged about their arrival.

For what would hopefully be the last time, several more men carried the disguised Ino into his office...

***


Where she would sit for about two hours stewing in her own sweat while her poor neglected belly gurgled in pain. A, apparently so intent in his training that he had immediately tuned out the strange churning sounds coming from this most massive meal he had allowed to sit there, went right back to his training without a second thought. Of course now, two hours later, he was hungrier than he'd ever been in the last fifteen hours. His brother, B, would be out for quite a while. So why not have a nice peaceful rhyme-free meal for today?

He opened the lid and nearly crapped his pants.

There, in the center of this fine platter, was the biggest ball of fat he'd ever seen. Her hair, limp from the sheer humidity she'd been forced to endure, fell over one eye and rested heavily on her padded shoulders that heaved with her labored breaths. Her stomach, going through severe withdrawals from not stuffing her face nearly constantly, had caused her so much pain that she was moments away from sobbing. She was, of course, naked. Oh, wait, that's why his eyes bugged out. You could probably guess that one so accustomed to constant comfort such as Ino would have taken off her skin-tight dressy kimono (that was really just cutting inches into her gut anyway) in an effort to cool down, right? Anyway, yeah, that's what happened. However, her massive stomach folding over onto her thighs kept her crotch warmer than Summer embodied, she was sweating in every nook her flabby body had to hide, and she... she just looked awful.

"Oh...." she moaned weakly, "H-Hello Raikag... Raikage-sama..." she smiled weakly.

Apparently, she was rustier than she had assumed earlier. Months of neglecting practice for obscene amounts of food would do that to a girl.

"The Hell?" A asked himself, "This bitch is hyooooge!"

"C-Can I... uh, talk to you about the... uh, Cooking Ninja? Over some... food, maybe? I'msostarving!"
13131211.title: Phase Two?

choices: Some time later, and Ino's getting pampered, spoiled, and fed to extremities...
Rescuing diplomats (Tsunade+Shizune) are shocked at the tradeoff months later...
131312111.content:
The ever-hulking mass of muscle that was A the Raikage was caught off guard. There had been much better, more organized attempts at getting into his office performed by those selected few who managed to escape his murderous rampages; in fact, between now and their last plea of recognition, A had almost completely forgotten about those talented little buggers. Here he was thinking that they had been trying to butter him up with a nice meal, and instead they send the absolute strangest possible peace offering stuffed underneath a giant platter. There was no food, and that was hard enough on this muscled maniac's stomach. But to think that they had sent this ball of blubber to try and convince him? That's just poor planning and strategy!

However, she was about as far from an assassin as a kunoichi could get. So very young and so very, very wide for a girl her age. Pretty, for sure, but still. Her pale skin was a flushed pink due to the collected heat inside of her carriage. Her belly, a collection of thick rolls that heaved inward and outward rapidly with her labored breathing, was covered in a thin veil of perspiration that made her look damp to the touch. Her blonde hair, not exactly vibrantly mountainous before, had fell downwards due to the humidity of her breathing. Her single bang rested on top of her eye, leaving only one deer-in-headlights baby blue for A to see. Then again, at one time there was more of it visible. Her cheeks had grown so consuming that they had started fighting her peepers for space. She looked a little squinty at all times these days, due to that and in no small part to the weeks being hidden away from the sun in her hut where the Elder Chefs kept her.

She looked up at him, he scowled at her from his impossibly large stature. It was a stand off between them, and there was no doubt that A was going to throw her out of his office in a manner reminiscent of her own village leader. In a rare moment of quick thinking, Ino's plump fingers instinctively pretended she was holding a burrito to her mouth formed the Yamanaka Clan's signature hand sign and concentrated all of her barely-used-at-all chakra for the first time in months. She felt it, the familiar sensation of floating. In what had been a long missed sensation, Ino's body was no longer weighted down by all the blubber she had accumulated in her lethargic overtaking of the Cooking Ninja's village. Her astral projection form remained slender and beautiful, the girl she had been before all this kidnapping mess started. It almost made her realize just quite how fat she had become, but her thoughts were interrupted as the objective flaunted its glistening mocha-skinned muscles directly in her face.

She flew in, as usual, but found that she was all but instantly rejected by him. It was a shocking feeling. Literally, the man's aura was so strong that it actually shocked Ino's projection. A foot over, her own body quivered in discomfort as they shared the pain. She tried again, and once more before becoming angered. Her time was up, and she was forced back into her own body.

"Ha." A grunted, a sadistic smile crossing his face, "Yamanaka's huh? My dad told me about yer grandpa. Good man." the frightening man's smile was even moreso- intent to kill or otherwise, he was just all around intimidating. "Yer a long way from Konoha." he said curtly, sitting down to face Ino, "And I take it you're a patron of the cooking nin, huh?" he reputably pat her sagging gut for emphasis. Inwardly, Ino fumed. Had he not been so terrifying, she might have just ripped off and then ate his mustached face. However he was pantswettingly so that she decided against it. "Y-Yeah, I may be starting to put on a little weight." she said nervously.

"Yeah, those cooking ninja'll do that to ya." he said forewarningly, "You can see why I cut their funding, couple years back they all but ruined more than a dozen perfectly good squads with their cooking."

"B-But hold on Mister Raikage!" Ino said, not entirely aware of the plotline up until now, "M-My team mate Choji and our friend Naruto said that they've developed a miracle diet ramen!" she said hastily, "I-I'm sure they could work something out with you!"

"Sh'yeah, somehow I don't believe that they've quite gotten into mass producing it yet." A said flatly, obviously (to everyone else, of course) eying Ino up and down like a rejected pig from the slaughter.

It was at this point that a kunoichi was given two options. Option one was to suck it up and take it like the battle-hardened death machines that female ninja were supposed to be. Here, she would say that she understood completely and promise one last chance at acceptance before the deal was called off. Had Ino followed this plan, she would have gone back to the Chef ninja with her tail wedged between her overpoweringly flaring cheeks and ate them out of house and home until she was pawned back off onto the Leaf Village. Option two on the other hand, worked much more into Ino's strengths: drama.

Ino, out of fear of getting her face ripped off and eaten, was already a little misty eyed. Her stomach pains were terrible, and she had gone more than three hours without something delicious passing through her lips. She was emotionally distraught and frazzled already, but the fear of not even getting back to the Cooking Ninja frightened her even more. Because that meant she'd be in here with this scary s.o.b. It was here that she put her plan into action:

"W-W-Waaaaahhh!!" she suddenly bawled, catching the emotionally reserved man completely off guard once more

"N-Now hold up-" he started, only for Ino to simply start crying louder

Ino explained the story, with a few minor details conveniently forgotten (namely her being the prime reason that they were almost out of food) through broken sobs and harsh snotty sniffles. Her body quivering, she wailed hysterically and cried loudly throughout the entire thing until she was through. A, having absolutely no idea what to say, was taken completely aback. "S-So you say that they're running out of food?" he asked, stuttering not out of sympathy, but of simple emotional discomfort at having a crying woman he can't sucker punch into solitude. Ino sniffled again, "U-Uh-huh..." she said like a small child. "And if I don't fund them, they're all going to either die out or abandon their village?"

"Y-Y-Yeeeeessss..." she said pitifully, "Its so sad, buh-because the food they make is soooo good!" she somehow managed to ignore the massive squishy cushions that her plump fingers brushed against, "S-So do you think you could... I don't know... help them out? Help me out? All I wanna do is go back home!"

A was silent. He stood up solemnly and headed towards his window...

"How could I refuse?" he said kindly, smiling back at the still-blubbering butterball situated on the silver platter, "You tell them that they've got a deal- and that they've got you to thank."
131312111.title: Sympathetic Tactics

choices: Decided to empathize with her, maybe she could be of help
Yell at her, she should be doing as Ino asked! not whining
1313121111.content:
As the chapter title reads it was some time later when Ino Yamanaka was sitting in her quarters in the Raikage's office building, her team of personal chef's from the Cooking nin had made her a worthwhile meal.


Ino was living it up in the Raikage’s office, having a blast. It was getting close to lunch time and the porky blonde was busy stuffing her face full of a sweet vanilla pudding, savoring every bit that the Cooking nin had conjured, and wondering when her next dish would arrive.

It had been awhile since her less than formal meeting with Raikage A, but since then many changes had taken place since then. For example the cooking ninja had finally acquired all of the ingredients they needed to make their ridiculously fattening meals. Oddly enough though they opted against this and began using the skim recipe they received from Teuichi and mysteriously forgot to use until now. With it they began concocting healthy and delicious food stuffs for the use of the Cloud Village.

Surprisingly the plan worked and the Cloud ninja finally began to get something vaguely similar to respect from the other villagers, and attention through their connection who was talked about amongst the Cloud ninja. Rumor had it that she was some sort of jonin the cooking nin had captured to curry favor from the Raikage. Other rumors said she was a traitor with valuable information and was supposedly a great beauty. The less popular idea was that she was an overweight kid who had a few skills, but overall wasn’t much of an asset. The truth was close to the last one, except she was only an asset to the Raikage as a bargaining chip.

While Ino held no useful info A could use her to get the leaf to finally give his village the Byakugan or maybe give them their jinchuriki. If they wanted they could also give her back and use the gesture as an example of good will among shinobi, possibly allying themselves with the village. Still Ino was unaware of this and was busy stuffing her already gargantuan stomach. As she ate several fresh slices of blueberry pie, Natsume groaned in disgust.

She couldn’t understand for the life of her why Ino was still being such a pig. She was even offered the less fattening food, which by some miracle made everyone who ate it thin in a matter of days, but the offer was rejected.

“I’m too used to the way the normal food tastes. I like it way more.” Ino had said as she swallowed some barbeque and moved on to miso soup. Still Natsume was assigned to be her main bodyguard, and it was pretty much being her lackey, serving her food, and helping the blonde tub of lard to her feet so she could waddle wherever she needed to.

“This sucks.” She said. “I hate being a grunt…”

Ino heard Natsume’s complaint and…
1313121111.title: Some time later, and Ino's getting pampered

choices: And so, she bathes just as contendedly as she lives now...
Hey, you know what's good in a WG story? Eating. Lets have more of that.
13131211112.content:
Ino's twenty-some-odd inch around jiggling masses of upperarms slapped against her padded overlap of breast as she suddenly stopped eating, her pouty lips sticking out even moreso as her chin fought for space to scowl. Her little blonde brow furrowed as her expression, riddled with the debris of her last culinary conquest, twisted into a pout. "Hmph." she said indignantly, "It's not my fault your diet food is crappy." she grunted, placing her now empty bowl of miso amongst the other forgotten containers of her pre-lunch snack. "I mean, when I've had all these great meals brought to me day after day, a girl tends to learn what she likes. And I like my regular meals."

Of course a little diet food couldn't have hurt. In fact, it probably would have helped. No, it definitely would have helped at least slow the great increase in mass that Ino's body had undergone (and was still undergoing). Due to a hedonistic lifestyle the pertained to as little movement possible from whatever brave sitting apparatus that she had overtaken, Ino's once toned body befitting of a kunoichi was completely lost underneath a sea of pampered blubber. Rough calluses earned after hard training sessions with Asuma and Shika-Cho remainder of the Team 10 Threesome in the Forest of Death had grown puffy and soft. Her hair, cut short due to her scuffle with Sakura during the Chunin Exams, had almost grown back to its former length but had yet to be placed in a ponytail due to the simply exhausting amount of energy it would require on Ino's part. Even her nails, always well-off enough, had grown weak and easily broken due to her luxurious lifestyle of no worries what so ever.

Oh, and of course on top of all of this, she was really fat. But that should really go without saying, considering we all know the title and purpose of this interactive.

Swollen and engorged with meals past, Ino's figure had outright ballooned unto ridiculous proportions. Had Ino ever stood much at all, and had she not had a massive cushioning between them, Ino's breasts would surely have been pendulous on her old body. Engorged and massive with fat, they swelled up and out until they simply grew too large to look over. Heavy and soft to the touch, Ino spent many a foodless hour or two subconciously exploring her new bazongas, having never had much for the boys to paw at back before this whole mess started. They lapped over the side of her upper-most belly roll and rested heavily on the next. Acting as a pagoda, Ino's relatively bottom heavy shape (if one could still call it a shape anymore) got wider and wider as one travelled down it. At her narrowest around the torso, once could just barely wrap their arms around her and get smothered by her melons (Natsume would know, on her more lethargic days Ino had to be hoisted out of bed and into the bath) and at her widest she was... well, very wide. Her fat belly spilled over her hips and completely censored her from the waist down. Censored her from any hint of any genitals, actually. Her doughy muffin top was squishy to touch and deep to poke. And of course the hips they over-rode were only an inch or two narrower, supporting a posterior that was unbelievably mountainous in its own right. Lumpy and riddled with cellulite, Ino's rear was just a large cushion for her to plop her enormous bulk down upon. When sitting, it spread almost half a foot wider than when she stood!

Of course this was all lost upon her. Beyond the tip of her stomach, little else existed to Ino anymore. Oh sure, on the nights when she lay atop her mountain of pillows fighting through the night until her pre-breakfast breakfast, Ino would often fondly think of her home. Some nights she weeped openly about how she missed her family and team mates, even billboard brow and Naruto were on her list of those to-be-missed. However her worries and cares vanished when she was brought something nummy for her to choke down with reckless abandon. She would greedily indulge herself for hours as whoever assigned to guard her (usually the unfriendly Natsume) would watch in relative disgust at how far Ino had fallen. And of course she did so without looking back- metaphorically speaking of course, there was no way Ino's deep accumulation of neck fat or hanging chins would allow her to look back much farther than a half-hearted turn- or worry about her once girlish figure. She had simply grown too used to the lifestyle and had grown addicted to the rich calorie intake. In the few times she went without food, Ino was harsh and jumpy in her withdrawls.

Natsume grumbled again as she watched Ino's bulk plop lazily against the pillows used to support it. "Sure, whatever." she rolled her eyes and took a few steps towards the bulk, "You done?" she asked curtly as Ino's displeasured gaze travelled along with her every move.

"For now." Ino said, her voice a little on the deep side due to the heavy accumulation of fat around her neck, "Are you sure you're not giving me that crappy diet food?" she asked breathlessly, still a little winded from her meal, "It sure took me a long time to get full."

"Believe me, Cheif Natsukasa definitely didn't make you diet food." she quipped dryly.

Since being exposed to the great pampering that the Cooking Ninja had put her through in an effort to keep her quietly appeased, Ino's once only somewhat bratty bit of a girly-girl personality had undergone a full crowning ceremony. The slightest inconvenience was enough to turn her sour these days, so it was an understanded fact that she was either left alone during these spells or given something to snack on- depending on the situation.

"Ugh... I don't know." she said lazily, "Could you draw me a bath? I feel a little dirty."

"You just had one a few hours ago."

"Then maybe I just want to soak a little!"

Of course, even if she didn't want to, Natsume was going to draw that bath. Since realizing just how rusty she had gotten, Ino had picked up her signature jutsu once again. Every now and then she would abuse it for things that required a little more mobility than what she was granted, but boy did it tire her out...

"Fiiiine..." Natsume grumbled, rolling her eyes and retreating to the bathroom
13131211112.title: The life of a Diplomat

choices: There have been reports of a squad from Konoha coming to rescue Ino!
Tsunade still won’t hear us out!
131312111122.content:
Natsume began dutifully drawing the bathwater for the now completely naked Ino. Then she watched as the spoiled stuck up trotted like a hippo on two legs to the tub and slowly lower her entire bulk into the tub displacing gallons of water.

“Aaah! So good” she moaned throatily, her flab splaying out the width of the grandiose sized tub. Natsume watched disgusted, as Ino made like a pig in mud; the blondes flesh slurping and practically absorbing the water in its fold. Now submerged in the tub Ino could move a little better than when given the full gravity of gravity. She closed her eyes, enjoying her temporary buoyancy while enjoying the hot waters bubbles as the caressed and cleaned every inch of chub. When she opened her eyes, she found her skin had turned a nice shade of pink almost like the color of...

“Hey!” she shouted at the poor nin Natusme who was on her way towards sneaking out of the room.

“...Yes?” Natsume muttered begrudgingly beneath her breath and cursing her lack of “Body Flicker” jutsus (A.K.A The puff of smoke technique.)

“Didn't I ask for some beef and rice bowls?” said the commanding voice of Ino.

“No...” Natsume said properly recalling the entirety of meals ordered over the day. She had just eaten minutes ago; she couldn’t possibly still be hungry could she?

“Well I am now! Get on it and make sure the inside is as pink and perfect around the middle as my wonderful skin.” Ino ordered licked her lips at the thought of a hot and steamy delicious bowl of rice and cow.

Disgusted by such gluttony, Natsume did not give the customary bow as she went to put in the order, electing to curse as she left the room instead. “That blonde bitch!” Who was she ordering her around like that? When was she going to get some time back to herself? Hopefully she could sneak out for a bit while the “prisoner” (if you could even call her the prisoner now) was gorging herself. Better to keep her busy eating, than to have to do more of her degrading commands.

“Five bowls of Beef and rice!” she shouted to the head chef or should I say head Cheif Natsukasa.

“Five?” He shouted in disbelief. “That’s more than I eat in a day!”

“Five.” she echoed, simply shrugging. Chief Natsukasa mirrored the shrug knowing he didn’t have a choice if they wanted negations to go successfully with Konoha. “Well at least she likes my cooking” he muttered as he started cutting up a fresh slice of beef.

Moments later Natsume returned to the tub with the bowls in hand.

“About time” said Ino haughtily

“Please enjoy” said Natusme customarily but through her own gritted teeth. Ino needing no sign to start eating helped herself. There was no way Natsume was going to stick around and watch this…but somehow…strangely…much like a shinobi battle the vicious energy Ino was attacking the bowl with was drawing her in.

Thick and fatty pieces of meat were instantly inhaled into a pair of pink massive cheeks, cheeks already rising full of rice to begin with. The grunt and gulps (or were they moans?) emanating from the pampered plumper were also not unlike those of the battlefield. The obese Ino was oblivious to her observer; too focused on fighting her bowl and getting more food to her stomach. The beef was cooked to such a sizzled perfection that she hardly needed to chew. Ino loved the flavor. This was the food she’d wanted and she simply could just not get enough of it! Natsume saw as the first bowl fell empty to the floor, and then the second moments later. Wide eyed she realized the blond had already devoured half of the massive order. So much for getting away for some free time… That realization was when Natusme saw her future flash before her eyes; the spoil teenager in front of her eating and eating day in and day out, growing larger and heavier after every passing meal. Natusme would have to learn the multi clone justsu just to carry her around if she got too heavy! Quite the horrifying thought.

If only there was some sort of change in the negations between the nations. Something! Anything, was better than this…Then as if an answer to her prayer a fellow cooking nin suddenly burst into the room.

“I have just heard the news!” he announced at the top of his lungs.
131312111122.title: Bowls, baths, beef, and blonde bitches

choices: Success! Tsunade's taste buds pop and she has newfound interest in the cook-nin!
Or it backfires. I don't know how, but sure. Why not?
1313121111222.content:
"Tsunade sends no regards towards the rescue of Ino Yamanaka... so it is our duty to..." the cooking ninja took a deep sigh as if forcing the words from his mouth with an unsteady feeling of growing woe, "To keep Miss Yamanaka under our care until we receive word... be it positive or negative."

The room grew quiet as this nameless ninja's words permeated all those within earshot. He, the nameless one himself, already seemed to be rather down upon relaying the message to his chief and superior officer. Most of the common cook-nin, as well as almost all Cloud-nin, still remained in the dark towards Ino's "captivity", however his working directly for Chief Natsukasa had lent him insight towards the gluttonous grip that the growing blubber ball held on the Cook-nin as a whole.

The Chief shared similar concerns as his subordinate. Despite his people prospering in the Land of Lightening since Ino's arrival, her usefulness was all the more slipping. Granted, through her crying and cunning his people had eeked their way into being a staple of Kumogakure's diet, but her own diet was a steadily increasing slope of difficulty. And since he, his four most trusted assistants, and Ino Yamanaka herself had been promised residence in the Raikage's Mansion all Ino had done was grow steadily larger and larger while his workload grew heavier alongside her. Despite being the head of his people, he spent a good majority of time tending to his special diplomatic project and it was exhausting his frail body.

However no one was more exhausted than poor Natsume Hojohoshi, appointed since residence in the manor as Ino's personal attendant. Anything she needed, it was Natsume's job to make sure she got it. And since most of it pertained to food, her cooking skills became less of an honored family skill passed down from generation to generation and more of a gimmick for Ino to abuse. And not only was it her job to cook, but whenever Ino needed to be hoisted up or assisted in dressing or cleaned or any other embarrassing task yet to come or to be mentioned. It was just awful. Ino had become a fully-flourished brat with a severe eating disorder since she had been abducted and Natsume was earnestly considering lugging the fat tub over the border herself... if it wouldn't have broken her back.

Though no one seemed to be as affected as Ino Yamanaka herself. This was most evidenced when she took a full two minutes to resume feeding on her third bowl of rice, and further speculated when she simply threw the bowl to the side and yanked the next two together simultaneously. She seemed to be scarfing down the food angrily, as if it had done her wrong and she was getting revenge. There was no tasting, there was no pleasant moans of satisfied gluttony; only sucking down whatever remained in her bowl for her to eat.

"More!" she roared from her seat in the tub, shifting her bulk and splashing around, "I said I want some more!!"

"M-Miss Yamanaka, are you-

"Of course I'm alright you idiot!" she barked at the Chief now standing outside the bathroom with his eyes covered, "I'm just hungry okay! Is that alright?! Don't tell me you guys are gonna forget about me too, huh?!"

"M-Miss, I'm sure we'll here from the Lord Hokage in no ti-

"And stop looking at me like that, this is in no way comfort food, you slack jawed pervert!" she hollered as she tried fruitlessly to hide her dangerous curves with swollen (though still far too small to do anything but enhance her cleavage) forearms, "I'm just hungry because you guys slack off too much!"

***


"MOAR FOOD!!"

Natsume stood in the kitchen with the Chief, still completely within earshot of Ino's developed windpipes. She recoiled slightly at just how loud that girl could get. It made her like her all the less, considering that she would have to put up with that.

"My Lord, forgive me for asking, but what are we going to do?" Natsume asked her trusted father figure, "We must convince Lady Tsunade to take Ino back, why hasn't she responded yet?!"

The elder sighed and turned the rice, leaving it to sit as he stood; left weary and frail from his constant job of cooking. What used to be a labor of love for his people and cuisine itself had lost its appeal due to people like Ino Yamanaka. Those who just ate for the sake of eating and overindulgence. He is obviously overworked and tired and wishes for nothing more than to sit down.

"Its not quite that simple." Natsukasa said wearily, turning slowly to his fifth-in-command, "Lady Hokage has the entire Land of Fire to preside over. Judging from what I've seen from the Raikage, it seems like a stressful job... though our own predicament seems much more strenuous now, I'm sure that she will receive the message in due time."

"Its been eight months and we've sent seventeen letters, three postcards, and a video tape!" Natsume roared, "What started out as a simple quest to get into the Land of Fire to start life anew has snowballed completely out of control. Forgive me my Lord, but something has to be done about this!"

"I am more than aware, Natsume." the chief said calmly, "I am old, and tired, and my days are all but used. If Miss Yamanaka keeps treating us like this, I will certainly perish. Though I am pleased that she has grown to love our food, I feel that she has succumbed entirely to it and lost herself... if only I had more time. To make more people smile with delicious cuisine like the old days. To spread our lovely recipes to those who truly deserve them..."

It was then that, believe it or not, brilliancy struck Natsume.

"...You don't say?" she said coyly, "Do you think that the Lady Hokage would be more willing to listen to us if we provided her with a few samples?"

"Natsume? What are you getting at?"

"Well, if we each provide a few of our specialties and procure them for the Hokage, she might see just how lovely our food is and how beneficial it would be to the Fire Nation. And as long as we get her attention she might even take a few things back... you catch my drift... erm, my Lord?"

"I do..." he rasped, "I certainly do..."
1313121111222.title: Big Girls actually cry quite often...

choices: Agree to accept the cook-nin’s offer! (Konoha’s about to get larger…)
Go visit the Cook-nin myself for a bit. I still don’t trust them 100%
13131211112221.content:
“Wait! Don’t you think you should at least try one? I mean that one with the beef looks super yummy!” Shizune was busy practically begging at Tsunade’s robes as she made for the trash.

Minutes earlier the diligent assistant to the Hokage had received a large package addressed to the Hokage from the Cook-nin. The package seemed to contain multiple boxes of bento inside along with a note. Said boxes had been sent as a last chance option to get the Hokage’s attention, the hopes and future of all the cooking-nin as well as Ino, relied on what the Hokage would do next. Shizune read the letter to Tsunade after she had brought her the bento filled crate.

Dear Great and Powerful Hogake,

Please except this last offer of apology from our troop. We have made these with the very last of our draining resources and we only humbly ask that you try one box, and if you deem it fit, allow us to make more, not just for you, but the entire land of fire.

Oh, and we promise to bring back Ino too, as soon as possible!

Signed the Chief of the cooking-nin

Tsunade was suspicious the offering immediately, anticipating the goods inside to be laden with poison, and so she was now just about to throw all of the bento boxes away.
“Shizune! Has all of your training taught you nothing?” said Tsunade in her ever so strict tone. “A kunoichi warrior and especially a Hokage must always be suspicious of gifts from rival clans.” Shizune could only sigh as she Tsunade went to wipe the delicious looking bento straight into the garbage. “Wait! C-couldn’t I at least try one.”

“I’m sorry Shizune but your too important to lose, and if you were poiso-”

“What if we got someone else to do it? I mean you are the greatest medical ninja ever right?” Shizune insisted, although this time is was more for the plight of the cooking-nin than the chance to sample some food. Her ego thoroughly stroked, Tsunade agreed under the pretense that someone else tried it first. Shizune quickly left and returned with the first ninja she could find, a very sour looking Shikamaru

“Oh man,what is it now? Shikamaru groaned as he entered the room.

“Shikamaru,” Tsunade began, “We think we may have a lead on Ino’s case.”

“What!” a fearsome and urgent tone suddenly entering his voice at the mention of his former teammate. “Where is she! What do you need me to do?”

“Uh, well we just need you to try this” Tsunade said setting one of the many bento boxes down on the table before him. “Shizune seems to feel that we should accept the cook nin’s peace treaty and this offering, but I don’t trust it.”

“…You’re… joking right?” Shikamaru asked all intensity gone. Tsunade’s silence and serious face confirmed that this was indeed no joke. He sighed to himself, sometimes this town got too damn wacky. Begrudgingly and after calculating that this was probably his quickest option if he wanted to get out of here, he picked up one the boxes before him and using the pair of included chopsticks, he expertly tossed a piece of food that had been designed to look like the symbol of Konoha into his mouth.

As he began chewing the food, Tsunade and Shizune watched transfixed as the chūnin's usual scowl distorted into a small grin. “Hey, this is pretty good…” Shikamaru said attempted to keep his cool. He took another bite and then another, eyes widening in awe of the foods incredible flavor. Tsunade then stood up and swiftly grabbed him, a pink glow suddenly emitting from her hands as she closed her eyes in deep concentration. “Well… there doesn’t appear to be any fast acting poison in these, an if they were using a slow acting agent it would have showed itself as soon as it made contact with your stomach." Setting the surprised Shikamaru down she went on "Hmm, if they were trying to kill me they weren’t being that stupid about it.”

“So does that mean…” Shizune began, looking to the Hokage for approval before she helped herself to that awesome looking beef one she had her eye on earlier. “Sure. Fine. Help Yoruself.” Said Tsunade flatly as she sat back in her chair and slumped over her desk. It was actually a little disappointing that the food hadn’t been poisoned. She could have declared that such poisoning was an act of war on the cook-nin and then swiftly sent a squad or two of ninja’s to bring Ino back but, since the gift was apparently friendly in nature she was back into a political stalemate. Shikamaru figured he had served his use so he left, taking the bento box along with him as he silently left the room.

Shizune had found a box herself and was rapidly helping herself to its contents; her eyes began to sparkle as her taste bud began to savor the magnificent taste. “Thish ish really good.” She announced through a mouthful of rice to the unimpressed Hokage. “You’ve got to try dish stuff! Here have some Ton-Ton” and a she said this she placed an open bento down in front of the Hokage’s pet pig. Ton-Ton began to scarf her own bento down like a dog does from a bowl, giving a chorus of oinks in approval as she started to eat.

“What are you talking two going on about?” Asked Tsunade as she finally gave in and helped herself to a bite of one. “This is just regular-Whoa! These are pretty good!” said helping herself to another bite. Tsunade was now eating with great speed, her taste buds exploding with rich and savory flavors. Shizune had never seen the Hokage turn this wild except for the extremely rare instances where she won at gambling. Having tried only one a piece, they felt there was no reason they might not try one of every one of the pre-made meals that had been included, “Just to check for poison” said Tsunade rationalizing their gorging.

Soon all of the bentos were gone to both of the kunoichi warriors shock.

“I guess we *hic* overdid it huh?” said Shizune as she sat back in a chair, gut slightly distended from being so full.

“Maybe we did, *hic* but Shizune that was the best damn thing I have ever tasted. My tastes buds will never be the same. I must have more!” Tsunade concluded resolutely.

“I must…”
13131211112221.title: Chapter 14 Tsunade's Decision!!

choices: Don't you just hate Character Limits?
1313121112.content:
The harsh mountains that surrounded the Land of Lightning were never really inviting to the neighboring villages. Almost like a big picket fence made of rocks with a big "Beware of Tazer Effects inside" hung over the gate.

However in light of the country's recently suspicious activity of doing squat in the global scheme of things (not taking missions from outside countries, refusing to meet other Kage's for important meetings, and cutting off all trade to the outside world) it had become an unspoken goal between the remaining countries that they were going to find out just what was going on behind those earthen gates of protection that the Lightning relied a little too heavily upon. Time after time, ninja squadrons from all over the focal continent were deployed with missions that pertained to infiltrating the suddenly shady village. In the beginning alone only a scarce amount of spies returned, all with nothing to report that was out of the ordinary. Soon after that, the squads stopped returning at all.

And however unknown the predicament in the Land of Lightning was or had become, at least it's matters could be kept secret. For, as I'm sure we all remember the one insignificant cooking ninja that was literally punched out of the Hokage's office in the beginning of this whole affair, Tsunade had been dealing with her own problems as of late.

Long story short, said Cooking Ninja had survived. As soon as he was able to get up and about, he soon put his mind to regaining the cognitive functions that Tsunade's iron fists of drunken steel had knocked out of him. And from there he gained enough awareness to realize that not only had his team left him stranded in a country of whose leader had just attempted to murder the balls off of him, but that they had done such quite some time ago. With nowhere else to go, said cook-nin meekly cowered his way back to the office of said murderous Kage with his tail between his legs and desperately pleaded for a way to get back home. Tsunade apologized for their little dispute (an incident that several sake binges and a replaced window had completely wiped from her recollection) and promised that, when she had the time, she would work towards rounding up an escort team in light of his "special" needs of not being an actual ninja.

However as anybody who's at least made it to the pre-Sasuke's Exodus point in the series knows, between all the paperwork that Shizune has her buried under and an unhealthy obsession with booze and gambling sessions Tsunade barely has enough time to slack off and make herself interesting as a character- let alone balance one more mission on top of a mountainous pile of paperwork!

So, as the focal point of our story played out, the poor abandoned cooking ninja (let's call him Y-Mei) stewed in his own feeling of abandonment and general uselessness- whipping up delicious meals out of what have might as well have been gruel and handing them out to the local children (he was slapped by many protective mothers) until his culinary abilities caught the eye of the ever-frightening ever-blonde and ever-hammered Tsunade, who ordered him at once to make her something delicious right then and there on the spot. After amazing her with his ability to turn a common stapler into an egg-beater, he jiffy-rigged up a downright delicious meal for the woman who had punched him through a window.

So, you see where I'm going with this.

Of course, as it wouldn't be a quality weight gain story without it, the cook-nin became very much a staple in getting anyone in the Hokage's office throughout the day. Without her daily portions of ridiculously portioned meals, Tsunade wasn't exactly the happiest of campers. She demanded only the most delicious of foodstuffs for her consumption, things that would normally take hours through regular preparation only took mere minutes with the mystical magic of the suddenly-useful Y-Mei. Normally, since making such delicious food was such a time consuming process, one would have to weigh the want to the need of said cuisine. Not with this handy little bugger around! Tsunade had herself so stuffed at a constant stream that she was pretty much eating all day every day for months at a time!

This of course, was bad.

Not only for her girlish figure (we'll get to that later) but for the village itself. At this point, the hype for the missing Ino Yamanaka had died down overall save for her closest friends. As such, people were getting on with their lives; the economy needed to be regulated, missions needed to be dealt out, and that damn cat needed to be found at least four times since Ino's disappearance. You know the one who always claws out Naruto's eyes on his first mission? Hilarious.

However now that Tsunade's field of proactivity was dictated purely by the amount of food she had devoured that day, things became just a little unstable. Money was invested into wild gambles, the Ryu was no longer a countable currency to the rest of the ninja world. Businesses shut down while new ones sprang up constantly. The ninja academy suffered more than a few blackouts and no one was really going out and doing super-cool ninja stuff anymore. Times were hard thanks to this newfound gluttony that Tsunade boasted, and they weren't getting any easier with her just sitting around eating all day.

However, on the off chance that Y-Mei's reminiscing over his home country had fallen upon Tsunade's usually deaf ears, the subject of the Cooking Ninja's occupation of the Land of Fire came up once more...
1313121112.title: Elsewhere, in the Land of Fire...

choices: They speak with A about adopting the Cook-Nin before he reveals...
Wait, who's that massively overweight blonde girl in the Raikage's robes?
13131211121.content:
And that was all that needed to be said.

Eager as ever to feed her addictions, Tsunade packed her biggest robe to squeeze into and was guided by the experienced Y-Mei on their trip back to the Land of Lightning. With his clearance, the two of them along with their tag-along Shizune successfully made it to the Village in the Clouds after a long, out-of-breath trek across the continent...

Only to be left more out of breath when they were met with afformentioned crazy-ass stairs.

At this point, the first thing that someone would see on a dead-level view from the top of the stairs would be a chubby black haired lass awkwardly hobbling up the steps.
